text: citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon provided excellent basic lodging for us (married couple) who did not intend to spend much time in the hotel room other than to sleep and shower. The room was clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The location, while in a more busy section of Paris, was convenient for taking the Metro either from Gare de Lyon or Gare d'Austerlitz. Surprisingly, the hotel was extremely quiet, considering the amount of traffic outside. It was the most quiet hotel that I have ever stayed in. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Our family of 2 boys stayed in 2 rooms. It worked really well - air con works, bed comfy, clean, tech works, showers good. Small rooms but the Communal spaces are good. In the worse heat of summer this place was a saviour for us! Would recommend to other families but you defo need 1 room per child / parent.

This is a fabulous spot to stay in the 12e arrondisement. Smartly designed rooms; excellent food and drink services; top notch wifi and workspaces; ultra-friendly, multilingual staff. The hotel's proximity to Gare d'Lyon opens many options for train and metro travel, too. Easy to navigate to/from CDG airport. For business travelers: you couldn't pick a better spot in Paris.

An amazing hotel with great facilities, modern and clean. Stayed for one night as needed to be near train station. Rooms were equipped with great facilities, super comfy beds and a fantastic showers. Breakfast area / bar / communal area super stylish. Delicious breakfast! Great friendly staff.

Modern, clean and comfortable tech forward hotel conveniently located next to Gare de Lyon and a short walk from Gare dâAusterlitz. |Close to most Paris attractions and neighborhoods. |Friendly accommodating staff. Very helpful if the techie stuff gets a bit confusing.|Hearty and tasty breakfast buffet. Common lounge areas and workspaces.

I booked 18 rooms for a work trip and we can only say good things! The rooms are super clean, spacious and well thought out. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Location is easy to to and from. Would recommend!

This stay was the first time I'd heard of CitizenM and, as a digital nomad, I'm so glad that I found them. Besides the rooms, staff, and decor being great. They have have a well-equipped co-working area and 24/7 dining at the bar. I bought the membership the same day I arrived once I realized that it fits my needs perfectly. There are a lot of fun and funny touches everywhere if you take a moment to look. I plan to stay at a CitizenM everywhere I go.

I had a fantastic experience at the salon. I got a manicure,,, which was perfect. The salon was clean, the staff were super friendly and my nail tech paid great attention to attention. My nails looked amazing and lasted more than two weeks without any chips. I'll definitely come back and recommend them to others

âââââ Perfect Lounge for Work & Restâ

I spent six hours at the citizenM Gare de Lyon lounge without booking a room, and it was the ideal spot to work, relax, and recharge. Comfortable seating, plenty of charging ports, and a quiet, welcoming atmosphere. Enjoyed nachos with a beer at noon, coffee in the afternoon, and even a quick nap on a couchâshoes off, of course! A perfect oasis in the city for travelers needing a break while waiting for the next train to leave. Highly recommend!

Probably one of the best hotel to visit Paris if you are a tourist. Staff is Amazingly kind and all the little details added make the perfect experience (the umbrella system to lend is pretty clevee). Location is very useful if you take the train : no stress added and you can wait in the lounge part with maximum confort.

I really enjoyed my experience here. The staff was very helpful with check in and would say hello/have a nice day each time Iâd walk through the lobby. The first floor common/bar area is nicely decorated and there is a good water fountain that not only offers ice cold water but sparkling as well.

The rooms are not very spacious but perfect for a solo traveller like myself. The iPad made me think like I was living in the future and I had fun changing up the shower colours.

Location-wise youâre super close to buses, metro and ofcourse the sncf train station. There are also many restaurants, bars, pharmacies and groceries close by.

Donât miss the view from the 16th floor bar + watch out for the doors because they tend to SLAM shut

Definitely worth the price! We had the king room with the gare de Lyon view and it was just the best! We could see part of the Eiffel Tower from the room we were given! The room is pretty high tech with everything in control through an iPad! The staff is also incredibly friendly and helpful with everything you need. Ex: calling a cab / keeping luggage after check out. Will definitely book again whenever I come back to Paris!

This was my second citizenM hotel and it was consistent with my 1st. The configuration is similar, with reception on the 1st floor and checkin being self service.the rooms are comfortable and all controlled by an iPad. In Paris we met more American staff than French and they were super friendly and helpful. We were made very welcome.

To say that my stay at Citizenm has been anything but amazing would be an understatement. I was greeted at arrival by Lavinia, who was beyond kind and friendly and offered great recommendations. Then I made friends with Inka at the rooftop bar and have continued to chat with her every time we see each other. As a solo traveler, their kindness has made my already special trip in Paris even more romantic. <3 10/10 recommend you stay here, please easy to access transit to get anywhere in Paris.

We had CD an exceptional stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to o friends when in Paris. Service was great, close to Metro and train lines for easy travel through the city and room size was very comfortable

Everything was great! The hotel is clean, the location is nice and most importantly it is safe, it is easy to reach places to visit. Also, all the staff are very friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend it.

Stayed 3 Nights and unlike other hotels I have stayed & Spoilt like in Dubai ð

Incredible team comprising of Surath & Claudia. Service level is Top Notch

Highly recommend due to team around at the Hotel.

Rooms are small though but Paris doesnât sleep - Isnât ??

We had an excellent experience at citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon, and a big part of that was thanks to Cristina. Her service was outstandingâalways friendly, attentive, and willing to help with any request. She made us feel welcome from the very first moment and gave us great recommendations for our stay in Paris. Itâs clear that she is passionate about her work and truly cares about the guests. Thank you, Cristina, for making our visit even more special! We will definitely come back.
Super convenient location, able to choose a quiet floor, felt very safe and comfortable, staff very helpful. Would stay here again and at other locations.
Very efficient and modern take on a hotel.  The woman who checked us in was in quite helpful, especially after my wife's passport refused to be scanned properly.

Bed against window facing a building in construction . Terrible when waking on a Monday with workers facing you despite scenic view displayed on reservation
Service provided by lovely young people who seem to strive as human robots . The place is not reflecting French or Parisian culture /living
The breakfast is not appropriate for healthy eating
The warm food especially is not consumable .
Despite been situated in a convenient place. Not recommended. Price does not reflect the bad or lack of quality

Nice location, but the staff gave a key to my room to another guest and barely apologized for it, this is a major safety issue, good thing I was in my room because what if I wasnt there and had my things stolen? This is a major safety issue. Also a staff member came knocking at my door at midnight saying âserviceâ and when I said I didnt need anything he kept knocking over and over again and I had to repeat myself, then he said I called for a pillow which was not true, felt very unsafe during this trip. There is a nice bar at the rooftop but the staff would rather talk to each other than serve guests
Room shades did not function, staff would not resolve and left a sleep mask. Poor customer service. Would recommend you keep looking if considering staying here.

They do not clean rooms between nights. You wake up from cleaning lady noises in the corridor. Sound insulation very bad. Bathroom and shower literally in the room and not separate. I had hair on the floor and some things btoken in the room.
Overpriced massively.
However, what disappointed me the most was that this hotel does not offer a fresh baguette for breakfast. Instead it is this fake frozen baguette that you can eat anywhere in the world and has nothing to do with fresh bread.

I will not return to this hotel. initially they charged us much more in the municipal tax despite the fact that we had made the reservation through booking. they told us that a mistake was made and that we have to pay a lot more without any support and help. the rooms were very small. they didn't clean for free. I wonder why it is four stars. they offer two-star facilities. really tragic.

I feel this hotel tries to hard to be âdifferentâ with their concept. It sounds cool, but nothing really works. The self-check in isnât self-check in. They say to go to the hotel for a possible early check-in yet they donât let you check-in or put your name in the queue if they arenât rooms available. They tell you the app will notify you when your room is available but thatâs not the case because you arenât âchecked-in.â If I didnât return to the hotel to check on my room, many people who came in after me would have taken my place.

Then thereâs the room being cleaned. The say you have the freedom to choose which days you want your room cleaned but have no control when they come. And when they do (one day it was at 11 and another day at 4p), they are aggressive if you arenât ready for them. Even the interactions with the cleaners in the hallways were uncomfortable and cold.

Yes the in-room technology was cool, but Iâm not going to return to a hotel just for that.  But I will say that everyone in the bar to the restaurant to the front desk (though not managed or runs smoothly) was extremely friendly.

Wouldnât return to this location or any citizenM hotel. There are too many options out there any this hotel tries to hard to be different, but itâs just not needed and makes it more difficult for the traveler.
No electricity or WiFi between 11:00 to 14:30 and the hotel is unwilling to even offer any compensation.

WARNING: Staff will steal your items. Do not stay in this hotel.

An item was stolen from our room by the cleaning staff. The management said it would be investigated and would compensate us if the investigation was not successful. Later, after the item was not found, they changed their mind and said that we should file a complaint with the police.

We have been staying at this hotel 2 months ago, they have destroyed our laundry which we gave for laundry service, we are going through reclamation process since 2 months and itâs terrible, everything was fine until we left the hotel, hotel manager assured that situation is going to be solved (in person!) when we were at the place. As soon as we left, hotel started ignoring our e-mails and is not responding. I have called 4 times by phone and Iâm never able to talk with manager. Seriously, if you wear pricey clothes, stay away from this hotel and laundry service! Itâs terrible and itâs going to end at police and in a court as simply we donât know whatâs going to happen next because nobody respond to us. What a terrible experience, I travel a lot and have never experienced something like this!!!

We had a good arrival and we told the concierge that our booking didnât appeared in the app, and he said, no problem, did the check-in in 2 minutes and thatâs it. we stayed two nights, the first  night the tv service wasnât working. The only response was: sorry we will pass your complain. The second night when we arrived the room was not clean, after complaining the response was that we had to requested via app, which we were not informed about. Trying to get a solution the lady concierge told me not to be so dramatic, a terrible answer to a disappointed guest. She brought fresh towels 20 minutes later and she literally said âheyâ handed me the towels turn around and left. Iâm very disappointed with the service and the way your staff dealt with the problem.

Terrible... you check yourself in, very expensive bar, staff that barely says hello.
Everything in the room works with the tablet... but the tablet doesn't work....
At the time of departure I ask for the invoice, they tell me that it will be sent to my email (which they don't have...) I insist but they don't care and they leave.

P.S. They try to imitate Mama Shelter but they don't even reach their ankle.

Racial profiling at it worst. A few incidents happened in the first day of arrival. Check-in was perfect. The staff at this area were friendly and professional. Everyone else really needs to be trained in basics on how not to be a racist. Went to breakfast and whilst everyone else was not asked for their details upon entering the (not very good) buffet I was asked to stop taking food until they could verify I was staying at the hotel. After this experience I chose to order my lunch from Deliveroo instead. I went to the outdoor atrium to smoke. I was carry my food but was not going to eat it there given the mornings unwelcoming experience. I was then accosted by a staff member (also blonde Caucasian as per the mornings staff member) and told I could not eat here with the food from outside. I said I understood I was just going to have a smoke. She said it again. And again I said I am just going to have a smoke. As I say there she just stood by and stared at me the whole time until I left. Then she followed me to the lifts. Then disappeared. This is terrible unwelcoming experience. I have stayed at Citizen M hotels in many parts of the world and this is absolutely a terrible experience. I am here for the next 4 days for business and am dreading every minute of it. A few bad apples can really spoil it for everyone. They really need to train their staff on racial bias behavior.

More like a 1 STAR property with a very poor guest experience. It felt like staying in a hostel vs. a 4 star property.
Cons:
1) Of the 4 nights we stayed, bedsheets weren't changed 3 nights in a row until we had to call the reception and complain
2) No room service
3) Shampoo/body wash wasn't refilled even after putting a written note on the empty bottle of shampoo/body wash
4) Electric sockets didn't work and I had to get an additional adaptor from the hotel for which I was asked to make a deposit of 30â¬
5) This property isn't close to anything in particular for business (an hour from the conference center in Paris) and landmarks
6) The staff was NOT HELPFUL at all and just acted helpless and kept saying sorry without any solution at 4 different occasions
7) They seem to have a self check-in experience but when we couldn't check-in and there was nobody in sight for almost 15 mins at the front desk to assist
8) No iron and ironing board in the room which is a big downside for anyone staying for business

Pros:
They have a smart home/room system in place where you can control the lights and tv with an iPad but seemed pretty unimportant when you can't get the basic areas of hotel/guest/hospitality experience right.

We stayed here and the rooms were fine. However, we left a personal item in the room. No fault but our own but when we called the hotel minutes after we left, they said they would have the hotel staff grab it so we could get it back. We called back the following day and now they âcanât locate itâ even though it was right on the desk in plain sight. Then the woman proceeded to tell me that most likely it was thrown away. Her story changed over a course of 5 minutes. Just a word of advice for anyone staying here, make sure to take EVERYTHING before leaving. If you donât, most likely you will never see it again, especially if itâs valuable. Very rude and dishonest staff.

Donât stay here.
Poor discriminatory service at the lobby.

No service dogs allowed in the lobby? Because people may be allergic. But i bet the hotel serves peanuts and other foods people may be allergic to.

What a joke!

- very old and cheap towels quality, we received twice torned towels.
- no hot water in the shower for 10 hours during the day not night time.
- friendly staff.

I had an accident infront of the hotel. I asked their help whether I could wash my hands and the wounded partsâ¦the hotel reception refused to give me any help saying that the toilet is reserved only for hotel guestsâ¦Zero empathyâ¦shame on you.

Disappointing @citizenM are not allowing guests to reschedule bookings to other dates if they cannot fly due to adverse weather conditions. My flight is cancelled but they won't accommodate a booking date amendment. I will be using a more customer friendly hotel chain in future.

From start to finish, the level of service and hospitality at this hotel exceeded all expectations. Lea and Harper not only helped us with our booking beforehand but continued to provide outstanding support throughout our stay, making us feel welcome and well-cared-for. The staff as a whole were incredibly friendly, going above and beyond to ensure every detail was perfect, making our experience even more memorable.

The hotelâs amenities were top-notch, blending modern technology with convenience and comfort. The check-in process was seamless with easy-to-use computers, and the in-room tablets provided quick communication with the staff and allowed for complete control of room settings, adding to the overall convenience. The room itself was immaculately clean, spacious, and stylishly designed, offering a perfect blend of relaxation and functionality.

Breakfast was a true highlight, with a wide selection of fresh and delicious options that catered to all tastes. The generous portions and high-quality ingredients left us looking forward to it every morning. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough; it is an ideal choice for anyone seeking a five-star experience in both service and hospitality.

Very spacious and clean room.  Bed is comfortable and very well made.  Our view is very scenic facing the seine river.  Location is superb-very near train stations.  Breakfast is excellent - heaps of varieties. Free water and free bread to take back in room.  Staff is very helpful.  Seeing them smile all the time makes the hotel welcoming.  The lounge is very cute to hang out.   We felt very safe all throughout our stay.  We were allowed to store our luggage for several hours while we stroll around Paris.  Shout out to Montse and Agnesð

Great place for a touristy visit to Paris. Clean rooms, great breakfast place, amazing service staff providing a personal touch that goes way beyond what you get today. Wish I had noted the names of the staff serving during my stay but everyone working during dec21 and 22, 2024 receives my vote.
Great quirky hotel. Really friendly an accommodating staff.  Fabulous location. Near to lovely restaurants.

Fantastic experience! Being a hotel general manager in Asia myself, itâs not often that Iâm impressed by a hotel, but this hotel is different! Easy self check-in and -out. Great design all around. A room that works with everything in the right place and an app to control everything.  Great bed & shower. A cozy living room/restaurant with nice food. Great location next to the metro/train station. Overall a great experience and well done to the people who designed it and execute on a daily basis. Highly recommended.

What a great hotel right next to Lyon station - I wish all hotels used citizenM concept of checking in, quick easy no forms all automated - this to me makes me want to give it 6 star, rooms are small but comfortable and big enough for a couple, everything easily controlled by an iPad itâs so high tech, I would stay here all the time in Paris when I visit - great staff too

What a pleasant surprise! Needing only a 12-hour stay for a flight layover, we selected citizenM for location and price with little regard to other amenities. Upon arrival we found punchy design that emphasizes functionality without sacrificing a fun and artsy feel.

We appreciated a good, quick dinner and breakfast in the lobby that merges a restaurant with comfortable sitting and office work space.

Staff we encountered at self-check-in and restaurant were pleasant and helpful every single time.

The room was small, just barely adequate because the queen-sized bed could only be accessed from one side. And it's good there was office space in the lobby because the room didn't accommodate desk or computer work. This was countered by cleanliness and efficient design that used every square inch, making the key functions of sleeping and bathing easy and comfortable, with perks like push-button controlled shades and lighting.

Overall, we'd return and would recommend citizenM for future stopover stays.

Super nice hotel ð¨ easy checking and Cristina receive with the big smile and explain us how is work the hotel.
Modern hotel the staff was super nice all the time.
Amazing facilities and hotel. Easily my favorite stay in Paris.

Really well located right next to the train with great access to the centre of town. The facilities are great. There is a restaurant and a bar. The staff were really friendly especially Noor, who checked us in and made us a card with a personal message.

We visited paris in the month if august and i am soo glad that we got to stay in citizen M with such an amazing staff. It was my brother in lawâs birthday and the entire staff was soo helpful that they helped us in giving supplies like the card, balloons and even the speaker. They kept the restaurant open till 12:30 so that we could celebrate the birthday with eiffel tower view. The rooms and lounge were top notch.  Really thankful to Titi for helping us. You helped us make a memory that we wont forget.

As always, our stay at citizenM was great. There is absolutely nothing to complain about. Above all, the staff are friendlier and more helpful than in any other hotel. Everything is very uncomplicated. The hotel is exceptional in its design. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the location is, as always, excellent. Thank you for a fantastic stay.

We stayed here for our 1st wedding anniversary and enjoyed it a lot. I want to personally thank Claudia for making our stay extra special but also the rest of the staff which was super friendly.
The hotel is located very well with metro & RER nearby and the breakfast is amazing. The room was great and the bed super comfy. Overall a great stay!
A very clean and comfortable room in a great location if you are traveling from gare de Lyon. Go to the sky bar.

Best hotel within this budget. The room are slick and functional, the shared area are well-designed and welcoming. The staff is super helpful and has a great vibe. Citizen M is one of the most popular trendy Hotel branch on the market and this flagship is no exception to it ! Loved my stay with you guys. Thanks a lot.
Guillaume

I stayed at citizenM over the last few days with my grandmother and my family. Upon arrival I was instantly impressed by the level of service provided by each and every one of the hotel staff who made sure that my stay at this location could not have gone better! I'd planned to spend the first nights with my grandmother, an elderly woman, and the hotel staff accomodated her needs excellently going above and beyond for us. Be it ensuring that our rooms where close to eachother, booking restaurants or finding rooms that where suitable for my grandmother they did everything. Absolute superstars! I would especially like to thank the lovely Josephine, Soli and Nour at the reception for their incredible kindness and service. Thank you guys so much you really made my stay. :)

Perfect place to stay at Paris. Near Bercy Siene Bus station where we got on the flixbus!! Rooms were beautiful!! High tech, I personally LOVE IT AND ENJOY THE STAY. Close to at least one amazing restaurant and not very far from the metros and bus station to get anywhere. We made a good decision to stay here all 4 days

I booked this place because it was cheap, had air conditioning and king beds, and was right next to the train station into which we came from Marseille. I didnât expect much but I was blown away with how much I got for my money. A small room, yes, but the comfort, efficiency, technology, cleanliness, art, and proximity to the seine was more than I could have asked for. I will absolutely consider this accommodation chain in the future!

We absolutely loved our time at the Citizen M. I was initially skeptical about the small size of the rooms, but it was perfect for us and our short stay in Paris before heading to the French Riviera. The staff made the experience for us, they were absolutely incredible. At the front desk, Lea was amazing with giving us directions and secret spots to visit (go try the madeleines at Blue Sucre, they were mouthwatering!) and checked back in with us asking how our days were each time we saw her, which was so sweet. At the bar, we loved talking to Christina and the rest of the team!

The hotel is modern and comfortable. The room was a little worn out, and the location wasn't our favorite, a little rough around the edges. But we loved the experience enough to want to try another Citizen M for our next trip!

Everything is perfect, breakfast is exceptional: especially barista coffee and potatoes. The bed is truly of the highest quality. The only thing is weird light setup in rooms, quiet hard  it to disturb another person in the room if you want to wake up earlier

Double charged, refunded of only 10% of the second billing. Abusive, not professional. And I did confirm to the receptionist I did pay before online. She didnât check, made me pay again saying worst case Iâd be refunded. Well I was not. (Do not take the Â«Â viewÂ Â» itâs a con)

Credit card was skimmed in this hotel by a hotel employee. When I notified the manager, he told me that could and would never happen. Totally dismissed the whole incident. Be carefull here, had to cancel my card, you will be stolen from, check your balances hourly if you ise a credit card here...
The rooms are so small! A rabbit cage! The location is also very bad. Avoid this hotel, there is so many better places in Paris

very bad experience in this hotel, although the price is a bit high, night staff at the beginning show low respect and prevent my check-in, i had to find another hotel at midnight then, i believe this shouldn't happen in this world!
Poor service Saturday night at 11pm waiting 20 minutes for a drink then told by the girl behind the bar go upstairs to the other bar total bad attitude niver stay in the hotel again.
Scammed my credit card even tho I cancelled the stay 48hrs prior, this hotel should be reported to the authorities.
No TV signal.  Did not fix it after notice. Very weird noise in the morning.
Just appalling and the beds were uncomfortable

Dear citizen
We are surprised by your comment. Do not hesitate to share with you any experiences you add in our hotel. We are eager to take care of people and a person is always available to have a conversation and understand anything which can happen. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any information to share. Have a nice and safe day.
A.
Assistant Hotel Manager.
Watch out for pocket pickers

Totalement impersonnel.|RÃ©ception automatique qui vous fait penser que vous etes meme pas considÃ©rÃ©  .chambre minuscules .|Le personnel parle mal franÃ§ais .|Ca se veut jeune et sympa, c'est franchement horrible.|En plus ils refusent les espÃ¨ces.|PremiÃ¨re et derniÃ¨re fois

Ãtablissement trÃ¨s moderne, chambre hyper connectÃ©e (lumiÃ¨res intensitÃ© et couleurs, TV, rideaux et stores, tempÃ©rature), mais incapable de fournir une chambre chauffÃ©e !!!!
Le personnel,confondu en excuses, m'a proposer des couvertures supplÃ©mentaires et une boisson chaude. Ne pas rÃ©server en hiver !
Chambres conÃ§ues pour une personne seule (salle de bain / WC aucune intimitÃ©), trÃ¨s grand lit mais contre les murs sur 3 cÃ´tÃ©s
A chaque fois qu'une autre chambre s'ouvre, cela crÃ©e un appel d'air qui fait claquer la porte

Le lit au fond de la piÃ¨ce est grand, certes, mais ne pensez pas un instant en faire le tour; il est collÃ© Ã  la fenÃªtre et aux deux cloisons latÃ©rales. Bref, un plumage qui en oublie le ramage. Bref, indigne d'un 4 Ã©toiles. Le personnel est souriant, mais le service n'est pas lÃ , chambre pas faite, propretÃ© Ã  revoir. Bref, trÃ¨s mauvaise expÃ©rience.

Lavoro nel settore del marketing, ma sono caduto anche io nella trappola fotografica. Le immagini sono ingannevoli, le stanze minuscole e senza la possibilitÃ  di aprire le finestre nemmeno parzialmente. Sono scappato dopo la prima notte, e nessuno al check out mi ha consigliato sulle possibilitÃ  di un eventuale rimborso per le restanti 3 notti. Unica cosa positiva il personale della struttura, simpatico e gentile. Le 4 stelle su Booking e Google non hanno alcun fondamento, il CitizenM dovrebbe essere declassato   notevolmente. HÃ´tel design. Personnel sympa si on parle anglais... les chambres une honte pour un hÃ´tel 4 Ã©toiles. Un formule 1 dÃ©corÃ©. Lit enchassÃ© entre deux murs contre la fenÃªtre. Lavabo dans la chambre... chambre minuscule limite oppressante. Pas de plateau de courtoisie ...pas de bouilloire.  Bref derniÃ¨re fois. Pas du tout un 4 Ã©toiles.
Great hotel, location and service! Always try and find Citizen M wherever I travel. Top marks for the Citizen M hotel chains.

Perfect check in and out.Nice cozy place for relax and hang out with friends in their relax area.Wonderful breakfast. Hot and cold and free coffee and tea .Only complain is the bed has only one side climb in .Disadvantage for older people .Overall ,a super nice and friendly hotel.

Staff is amazing, very welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was superb!! Hotel location is great and right beside Gare de Lyon. Room was very small but come on, itâs Paris! Weâll definitely be back.

We stayed at citizenM on our trip to Lyon. The location was perfect as we were catching the train the next day. The rooms are small (the width of the bed). The bed, although comfortable, is located at the end of the room by the window. With two people staying in the room, the person sleeping by the window has to disturb the sleep of the other person if they need to use the toilet in the middle of the night. The door to the toilet/shower compartment was opening inwards hitting the toilet bowl and providing limited space inside. The rooms are quiet and the blinds are useful if early bedtime is needed. The top floor bar, with a view of the city and the Eiffel tower offered a good variety of cocktails and food.

I cannot recommend staying at this hotel more.
First, when we went to the rooftop bar that staff was SO lovely, and the drinks were delicious.
During the night, my boyfriend fell ill and not only did staff call the ambulance for us, but they were so kind and comforting and even handed us a card wishing him well and brought us tea once we returned.
The staff here are so kind, and I will absolutely be staying here again.

1. Perfect location - directly beside metros and buses and trains so all of Paris is accessible from this location.
2. Wonderful staff - so kind and accommodating! Always willing to help and incredibly friendly.
3. Clean rooms - Some of the rooms are larger than others so if you want a large room, get it on the side the views the Giant Clock and NOT the Rue Van Gogh (as those as the smaller rooms)
4. Great Social Spaces - two bars that have excellent drinks. The food isnât great for dinner but breakfast is and there are so many places nearby for food.

Great hotel for business travellers or tech friendly travellers. Firstly location is at a prime spot, which will help you explore the city; either walk, tram or metro or even by cruise. Secondly, hotel staff are so friendly and theyâre your go to people for everything in the city.

Next hotel rooms are so tech friendly and innovative I must say, they have an iPad which controls all your needs - TV, Lights, music and mood. And then you have a spacious bar on top and restaurant at the entrance along with co working area. You canât expect more for a working traveler.

Loved this stay. Only request is a better view. Which was sad for me at least.

Outstanding service and a prime location. The staff were extremely helpful, assisting with all inquiries and providing useful tips. The room was beautifully decorated, and the location was absolutely ideal.
kind staff, clean + modern rooms, and generally quiet

Our go to hotel whenever in Paris. Far enough from all the tourist attractions to have cheaper rates but right next to the train station that gives you easy access to anywhere in Paris. Rooms are small but clean, quiet, and pretty high above the traffic.

Our 30th anniversary has become memorable waking up to looking at the Effel tower because Danielle who greeted us first time kindly offered a room with a with a view.  Rooftop is worth visiting and there is direct passage to get to the station without going out to street. Very convenient place with pharmacy and bakery near.  Even though room is compact it has all basic needs with refrigerator and safe. Excellent shower, and bedding was comfy.

CitizenM's are a little different to your normal hotels. With bright colours and funky decor it's quite a refreshing look.

The rooms have enough space for a couple to sleep comfortably, if you want more room the large lounge and bar areas give you plenty of space to stretch out or eat some food. For those who smoke, there is an outdoor space on the dining floor where you can go outside without having to go all the way down to the street. From the top floor bar you can look along the Seine and see the Eiffel Tower in the distance.

All in all I would look to use this or any CitizenM in the future if they are all like this.

We had lovely stay this weekend . Reception and bars Staff are friendly. They also give us information about some famous landmark in Paris. The room is perfect, clean, smell lovely, modern and it has everything we need. Love the rooftop bar we get to see the Eiffel tower sparkle at night. Defenitly will choose this hotel again when we visit paris next time .

A great location, quiet area and a short walking distance to the interchange of railways and metros. Centralised location which make it easy for traveller like me with an active itinerary to go around Paris. The view from hotel room was fantastic that I can view the nearby canal and Eiffel Tower can be seen too. The staff service was great. The room was spacious with comfortable double bed. I love the smart controller using mini ipad to control the lighting, blind, curtain and TV. There is a nice bakery shop at the corner for quick bites especially for breakfast. Overall, convenient location and safe. Will come back to stay here again for my next visit.
Great hotel for staying a night. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and great staff. Canât beat the location for jumping on a quick train out of Paris, too.

Good value for Paris but not cheap. Pleasant, friendly atmosphere with lots of areas to relax. Food and drinks reasonably priced. Rooms are standardised and tiny, the same as CDG airport Citizen M. Bed is large, wide and comfortable but not too long. ( No problem for me @1,73m.). Not much room for 2 suitcases.
Good location next to Gare de Lyon and very near the Seine. Patisserie/boulangerie on the corner nearby.

First of all, I would like to emphasize the beautifully designed interior of the hotel, which with numerous aesthetic details provides the guest with a superior atmosphere of the stay. The stay at the hotel began with a futuristic check-in procedure, and the beautifully designed smart room with ambient light impressed me greatly and provided a great holiday. The cleanliness of the rooms and interior was at a high level. I especially liked the rooftop bar with the very friendly staff. Great location! High recommendation!

We made friends with the bartender Soli while staying at the hotel for the better part of a week. She is SO amazing and made our visit fantastic. Soli was friendly, made us delicious cocktails the entire time, including a custom one during an evening when we were sitting in the upper floor bar looking out the window at the lit-up Eiffel tower. Honestly wish we could stay longer!

The rest of the hotel is solid as well, especially the cafe/restaurant. My only complaint is that the room doesn't have a ton of storage so I wasn't able to unpack my clothes for our longer stay.

Room
The room was clean, well presented and requiring no updates. The Ipad controls the TV, climate and other things. There were plenty of sockets and my room had UK, US in addition to Eu. There is a small fridge in the room which can hold drinks and food. The shower was delightful with a smooth temperature control and powerful pressure. There is an not an iron in the room but there are ironing rooms situated on a few floors. I found the one on the 8th floor easily and it was clean and everything worked well.

Service
On arrival I was greeted with smiles and my check in was very smooth. My queries were answered comprehensively and professionally. Special thank you to Kristine who provided me with a list of vegan places to eat. Throughout my stay all staff were friendly. There was a good range of breakfast available and vegan options were available. The food was good and the coffee was strong. There are business and lounge areas which are ideal for chilling and or working.

Location
Ideally located for the traveller as it is moments from the Rue de Bercy exit of Gare du Lyon. The surrounding area felt safe even at 2am on a Saturday morning. I would visit again.

Loved staying here for four days while visiting Paris. The bar scene inside of citizenM is amazing & the staff is super friendly and welcoming! The area is a bit sketch at night â and a bit during the day. Highly recommend but be aware of surroundings in this area! Also, not many good restaurants/cafes nearby.

Unica cosa veramente positiva la posizione comodissima per la Gare de Lyon.

Wurde wegen der kalten Luft, die vom Fenster DIREKT neben dem Schlafkissen hereinkommt krank Ã¼ber Nacht, sehr kalte Luft die man nicht manuell kontrollieren kann. Roomservice ist nicht gekommen trotz Wunsch. Kein Mal.

Je suis passÃ© ce matin dans Citizen M gare de lyon pour avoir les renseignements concernant les salles de rÃ©unions. Je voulais demander le prix et le nb de per max pour la salle. La rÃ©ceptionniste m'as dit que it's too expensive. J'avais garden mon Souris tout au long de la conversation mais ce n'Ã©tait pas la rÃ©ponse que je cherche. Pas tout le mode chez sont comme Ã§a car j'ai pu parler avec une dame trÃ¨s sympa aussi. C'est seulement une dame blonde qui m'a dit qu'elle vient de Citizen M la Defense qui a fait cette rÃ©ponse, c'est parce que peut-etre je porte un t-shirt et les baskets avec un sac Ã  dos. J'ai finalement fait une reservation avec Mercure Gare de lyon, la responsable clientÃ¨le est tellement agrÃ©able.

I had a fantastic time at the citizenM! The staff was super friendly/helpful and the room was the perfect size for me (solo traveler). I liked how everything in the room was automated and easily controlled with the provided iPad. I also highly recommend the breakfast as it was delicious and reasonably priced. If you donât have a travel power adapter they can provide one at the reception desk. I had to do this and ended up liking it so much I bought one!
I only came here to make use of the coworking space but it's a really cool vibe with lots of interesting decor. Lavinia on reception was an absolute star and a credit to the hotel!
Great hotel with beautiful rooms and great location.

Great hotel in a good location. Room was small but very stylish and quiet. The staff at the hotel are very friendly! The food is good and the coffee and wine bar is a pleasure to sit at. Would recommend it in a heartbeat and would stay here again in the future.

First time staying at a citizenM property was a success. Very easy hotel to navigate with friendly staff. Rooms are similar to cruise ship rooms but that is transparent when booking. If you utilize a hotel as a home base for your travel and donât spend that much time in the room than this is perfect for you. Beds are extremely comfortable. Great location to hop on the train at Gare de Lyon. If I visit Paris again I would not hesitate to stay here again.

The staff is really friendly, Iâd like to say specially thank you to Jenya who was there at breakfast time! Generally speaking about the hotel, itâs not the newest one among the Citizen M-s, but the rooms are quite decent for their price (remember, itâs Paris)!ð

- Great for remote workers - Very fast Wi-Fi, very spacious common areas with desks and couches, as well as conference rooms for 10 people.
- Excellent location either. right by Gare De Lyon,
- Stylish, modern-art design of the foyer and bright, well-lit rooms. Very comfortable beds to sleep, ideally for 2 people who are comfortable with each other as the sinks are in the room.
- Would book again with my eyes closed.
- Windows cannot be opened - could be an issue if you are someone who prefers fresh air
Clean, modern, love the ambience in the room, nice restaurant and bar. Good access to various buses and metro. Only thing that would make it better is a fitness room/pool/hot tub. Would stay again

This hotel is fantastic for an individual or a couple. The bed is super comfy, the vibe with the lights is sweet and Gare de Lyon is a nice transit location to pretty much everywhere in Paris within 30 minutes to an hour.

Prices for the rooms are decent (not amazing) and the view from the top floor gives a nice overview of the city with the Eiffel tower in the far distance.

Staff are super friendly and the whole setup is very hipster and youthful; it's not your average hotel room as the room is a bit more compact and studio like but its great for students or those with young souls.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel or the staff! Self-check-in is fast and super easy, and the room was ready early and was clean. The hotel staff is amazing - super kind and welcoming! Which was great for someone who just moved to France in the middle of the pandemic. Everyone I spoke to was just wonderful. Breakfast was good (albeit smaller than when I stayed at a CitizenM in non-pandemic times) and the dinner was good as well and fairly decently priced. Would definitely stay again!

I love this hotel
1st time to Paris/France& this hotel & its staff made it marvelous!
Funky, hospitable, kind, centrally located, good food, reasonably priced
Good breakfast!!!!
Very kind staff, multi-cultural & young, great suggestions
Yes rooms are small for dads/daughters, so x2 rooms are good suggestionsâ¦it has the European size limits to Americans, but AWESOME!!
Great concept, great service, great funky messaging & great food & drink!!!!
Hannah, Kristina, Noor, mathias, Everyone was great!!
Front desk let is check early (or arriving day from USA) BIG DEAL!
And the staff was awesome fir directions in France!

Great location right next to the train station with the metro and RER. Mostly for business travellers that need to get in and out with little fuss. Rooms are small with just enough space for your basic needs and can be controlled through the app.

Go to the top floor bar and watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle at night.

Room size is good enough for 1 person.  Small for 2, unless youâre only using the room to sleep in.  The room is controlled via an ipadâlights, curtains, thermostat, tv etc. which is very convenient as you can do all that while in bed.  Thereâs a co-working space at the lobby for those who brought work with them, though thereâs also a small desk in the room.  Breakfast was decent.  Hotelâs location is relatively far from the main attractions, but thereâs a nearby train station (plus getting an uber was pretty easy which we did a lot of), so it wasnât a problem

The hotel staff are super friendly and helpful with the self check-in process. Love that the technology has allowed the hotel staff to focus on providing a better guest experience.

The room is super cozy and clean with everything laid out very efficiently. They don't provide some of the disposable amenities but that's not an issue for me, just be sure to bring your own. They do provide shampoo/bodywash and liquid handsoap.

The shower has great water pressure and doesn't run out of hot water. Super essential during winter!

I stayed here with my wife in early Feb 23, for three nights. The hotel is very close to Gare du Lyon and the Seine. Our room was compact but very comfortable with a big bed, good temperature and a great shower. What stands out about CitizenM is the staff and the vibe, they were so friendly and the bar/dining area and the adjacent rooms were very relaxed and enjoyable spaces to spend time in. I will definitely stay here again if I return to Paris.

This hotel was an incredible find!  It's a very high-tech hotel with self-check in with kiosks in the lobby and a  lot of cool gadgetry in the rooms themselves.  Pretty much everything in the room was controlled with a tablet (blinds, dimming lights, music, alarm, tv, temperature control, etc.) and there was some cool features like being able to cast your personal devices onto the TV if you're so inclined to watch something as you go to bed.  If you're afraid of not having a person, don't despair as there were people ready to help out in the lobby area if you struggle.  Most importantly, the room and bed were both HUGE in comparison to most European hotel rooms.  Bathroom was a good size too.

The bar on the top floor was also really great, with a very nice view of the city including the Eiffel tower light show.  It was nice to sit up there in the lounge area of the bar, have a drink, and watch the city.

Finally, the prices were pretty reasonable considering how much Paris can be.  I spent more on my hotel last year and it wasn't nearly as nice.  The only downside is it's a little far from a lot of attractions, but I like to walk anyways.  I will definitely stay here again next time I visit

My first time at CitizenM.  I am a big fan.  They have a really good understanding of what the customer needs and deliver it efficiently and with style.  Lots of welcoming, funky public space.  Small, but well designed bedrooms - efficient use of space, comfortable, fun design, controllable lights and blinds and with connectable media.  The Aircon was even good and gentle  (I normally hate Aircon!)
One downside is that one person has to climb over the other one to get out of bed.  The other is foam pilllows and duvets making for a hotter bed than ideal and less comfortable neck.  Other than that, pretty much perfect.

Excellent Hotel! An amazing service and staff (especially Henoch who was extremely nice and very helpful). We were 4 and ordered 2 rooms that were very clean and has all the facilities needed. Very recommended - we will definitely be back next visitðªð¼ðð¼
Super team and great hotel with nice location and amenities

Perfect place for a short stay and solo travel.
Staff are all super friendly and helpful.
Rooms are well equipped - only thing missing for me would be a Nespresso/ coffee maker.
The technology used makes your stay hassle free and all controlled by your phone or the in room
IPad, and avoids long waits at checkin and checkout - something major hotel chains should learn from.
Breakfast is decent with mostly good quality products, although fairly limited in selection, the price is very fair.
I lucked out with a room on top floor with an amazing view riverfront view of Paris you will not even get a most 5 star hotels in the city.

Definitely among the best Hotels I have stayed at so far.  Great hospitality from the entire staff. Everytime I went to the cafe to get some milk for our daughter, they gave immediate preference and attention. The cafe staff are amazing ð . The rooms are smart and ultra modern (although on the smaller side by US standards) . I would definitely rate this 10/10 or 5/5 any metric you want. Kudos to the staff (The best).
Great, modern rooms - very small but designed well. All room amenities can run off iPad - lights, music. Bed was comfortable. Large, public areas to hang out in.

Wonderful experience. Their staff is super friendly and well informed. Travelled in January 2021 when restaurants and  museums were closed in Paris. The staff provided up to date information, where super friendly and welcoming. Exactly what I need after a long trip. On top of that the hotel is super beautiful and the technology is the best one. It works beautifully.

I'm a huge fan of CitizenM hotels. The rooms, service, and general ambiance typically are great and show a lot of attention to detail. Our stay at the Gare de Lyon location exceeded my expectations.

Like the name says, this hotel is right by the Gare de Lyon train station. It provides a convenient point to hop on a train and get where you need to go in a short amount of time. We were able to get to most of the normal tourist spots in about 20 minutes or less from there. There are also some good spots nearby as well, like a pharmacy and some eateries.

The room was comfortable and clean. We had a decent view from up where we were. It was also quiet outside of some light traffic noise.

Servicewise, I had an excellent experience with some of the friendliest hotel staff you could meet. Henock, Ron, Blessing, and everyone else there went above and beyond for us. I hope to see them all again the next time I'm in Paris.

The entire staff, but especially Mercy, was awesome!  They understood and got for us everything we needed.   The room was also great even if it was small!   Loved the layout of the room too!   The best place weâve stayed in all France!
Small hotel rooms, but very gorgeous breakfasts, recommended, near to Gare de Lion station where near, very convenient to move around the city

Very nice hotel . I got my room booked at 12 floor and view was amazing. Although my room was a bit small but it is good for singles .
Definitely hotel must have rooms of all sizes .
Special things I liked most about this hotel is everything is automated right from check-in to hotel to check-out.
Room facilities like TV , lights windows curtains everything is controlled by a tablet in the room . Itâs great .
Hotel is in good location near to Metro and RER .
Hotels staffs are good and well behaved and groomed .
Breakfast is good and healthy too .
I had a great experience staying there .

Fun, funky hotel! We checked-in for our 4 night stay on my birthday and were treated to complimentary drinks in the bar! Nice touch. Check-in personnel were very helpful with questions. Bit of a walk to attractions, but it's right by two train stations.

The first good impression is at the very first moment one gets inside. All the smiling faces at the reception greeting you after the long trip. The whole ambience is spectacular. The rooms as everything else in the hotel is clean and really stylish. The hotel personnel is really helpful in many ways. It is a great pleasure for a guest to see adequate people who enjoy their job and more importantly they are always interested about how a guest feels himself not only in the hotel but also how is his visit in Paris. What was for me even more fascinating was how many different charity initiatives have these people. One last truly stunning and important thing : All these well behaved, polite professionals speak amazingly good English.

Just, amazingly perfect.

This is my third time at a CitizenM, but I'd almost forgotten how much I love their hotels. Arrived at Paris Gare de Lyon and the staff were waiting by the lift to help us check in.

We opted for the Landmark View when booking (since staying for a full week) - and it wasn't a disappointment, lovely view of the Tour Eiffel at night twinkling, and a big corner room. The cleaning each day was thorough - and we felt like we returned to a new room every night. Zero travel concerns whilst staying here, and (rightly) strict on their mask policy.

Throughout the whole stay we felt at home and had lovely staff greeting us every morning and evening. Literally nothing to change.

My partner and I stayed here for the first night back in Paris. Weâd never come across CitizenM hotels before and I loved the innovative Self-Check In system, itâs very easy to follow and parts are exactly the same as the Airport (Scanning ID documents).
We were greeted on arrival by Citizens Greg, he was fantastic in walking us through our Check-In, the iPad Room Control System and made sure we were aware to grab our free bottles of water from the Bar, before heading to our room.
Our room was fantastic! The bed was so big (King) and comfortable with extra pillows in the drawer under the bed. They make great use of space with the basin in the main room, freeing up the bathroom to be used simultaneously, the amazing shower (with a choice of Rainfall or Jet Spray) was spacious and great water pressure that is unaffected by turning the basin tap on. I loved that we could not only dim the lights, but change the colour. The electric curtain and Block Out Blind, also controlled by the iPad, was fantastic and blocked out the Sun so well, when my partner woke me, I had no idea it was 8am.
The room is silent, considering the building is so close to the Pont Charles de Gaulle (bridge - for non-French speaking people) and on the corner of two busy streets.
Check-Out was equally easy, just selecting Check-Out and placing the room keycard onto the sensor.
I would definitely recommend it and Iâd definitely stay here again. We need a Citizen M chain in Australia.

Handy location very modern and comfy.  Worth a stay over if in the area. Close to major  train station so access to all of Paris.   Breakfast tasty with lots of choice.  Friendly sociable bar.  Did not have Di net but many did.  Rooms high spec and electric enjoy...

We had never stayed at a CitizenM before, but for our honeymoon in Paris we decided to give it a go. We couldn't have been happier we did. The room was awesome... incredibly comfy bed, free movies, smart layout. We also loved that the Canteen was open 24/7 and that they had computers available for use in the lobby. Check in/out was a breeze. Location is amazing. Paul downstairs has great, cheap pastries. The metro is just a few steps away. My only complaint (and it's a little one) was that there is no conditioner or soap/body wash provided, so be sure to bring your own!

I stayed here for a business trip, booked for me. So was not expecting the amazing experience that is citizenM - from the checking in and out) being met by very friendly and inviting staff.. to the fantastically integrated rooms and the amazing attention to detail. I will definitely be joining the citizenM club and seek out their spots for the future.

We are very happy about our stay. The room was tidy and comfortable, and we really like the fact we can use ipad to remote control all the functions in our room. The top floor bar is great bonus and you may enjoy the nice view from 6pm. The bar staff at the first floor was also very pleasant, Danielson especially, who provided a great attention to us. Highly recommended, and we will come back again
Nasib and cristina was super welcomed  and all the staff super good i love citizenm

We like the Citizenm chain as weâve stayed at a London location twice; itâs fun, the food is good, bars are well stocked, and the rooms are clean, bright and have wonderfully comfy beds. This particular hotel has all of those things; we ate from the kitchen regularly and were always satisfied, and really liked being next to a main train station. We slept well and enjoyed the room overall. Weâve stayed at this chain before so we know the rooms are small, the bathrooms arenât really away and private, but we donât care. Stay here and get to know your partner on a whole new level; good for the relationship right? Staff was always welcoming. House keeping was a little hit and miss, but thatâs not a big deal to us. Paris has a lot going on and it was always nice to return to our little nook and snuggle up; enjoy!

This place is beyond any hotel that I have ever been too.
The bed is so comfy the decoration is cozy, modern and feels like home.
I love the customizable room features.
The staff is so friendly and smiling.
We will definitely look for Citizen M hotels anywhere we go

Cool joint! Modern, clean, and funky in a cool way. Rooms are small but have all you need. Fully smart controls for lights, blinds, TV, AC amount other stuff controlled via iPad. The rooftop bar on level 16 is sweet, that alone is worth it. Awesome views across to the Eiffel Tower to watch the sunset. Downstairs lobby is nice too.
