We stayed 3 nights at this nice hotel. Great location, good walk along the river, easy transportation to the airport. Very nice view from the window on the river, and we also could see Eifel Tower at the evenings, mornings. Very professional front desk, friendly staff, great breakfast. Spacious lobby, cafeteria, modern design. Amazing view from the 16 floor. There is not enough space however inside of the room, especially bathroom area. Nevertheless, our stay was really amazing.

Very beautiful high tech design hotel with all the luxury you need. As an interior designer I fell in love with the interior. So many fun details (signs, carpeting and moving lamps in reception hall). The staff was very polite and helpful. The room was very clean and fully equipped. Itâs fun to operate everything with the tablet (lights, sunscreens, tv). I would definitely visit a CitizenM again.

Perfect for an overnight stay if you need to be close to the gare de Lyon. Bed was so comfortable and the room had been kitted out with loads of cool little smart features, light controls etc. We ordered from the restaurant and the food was delicious as well. We were really pleasantly surprised with this place, which is also doing a great job of implementing safe covid protocols. Would recommend.

Upon arriving I was greeted by Emma, hotel representative, everything was outlined, a free drink. Emma was awesome! Free WIFI, near Train station, clean, space used wisely, quiet rooms, fast elevators, great food.

Very friendly and helpful staff, and the connectivity within the rooms (streaming from personal devices to the room TV) was very unique and useful. Did I mention the helpful staff? They've done just a fantastic job of taking care of us. One last thing: there was a (5-day) delay with the airline getting us our bags, so when the bags finally arrived the hotel even MADE A SIGN CELEBRATING THE ARRIVAL OF OUR BAGS. Such friendly, helpful people!!

If you seek perfection - this is it.. The hotel is just next level!  The interior and exterior designs are out of this world! It combines comfort with technology, innovations with style... just amazing ! â¤ï¸ And the service is super nice. Absolutely recommend!

Very modern and high tech. Everything can be controlled by a mini iPad, including the lighting colour in the shower! Self check-in, but there are staff to help. We had a lovely view of the station (Gare de Lyon) and out over Paris. Room was spotless and the bed was huge and ultra comfy.

Free Wifi, Self-Check-In/Out, Smart Rooms with moodlights and super comfy beds! Great location next to the train station and lots of restaurants just a short walk away. Staff was very friendly too. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. â¤

Just be aware that the rooms are rather narrow and the slightly transparent bathroom is right there in the middle, but there's a curtain if you need one.
Amazing stay! Very kind staffs (check-in, housekeeping, bar etc literally everyone is soooo nice) They made my birthday very special! Good view along la seine to Eiffel towel is a big plusâ¥ï¸

Excellent value for money and will definitely return!

Pros:
- very convenient location, only a couple of mins away from Gare de Lyon with easy direct access right next to the hotel
- beautiful interiors
- very clean
-  check in and check out relatively smooth processes
- comfy bed
- friendly gesture from the hotel for my birthday celebration

Cons:
- they push using app but the CX is not very intuitive yet. It was difficult to reach someone to communicate a last minute change in check-in but eventually it was resolved relatively promptly via their Whatsapp help line
- would be great to add small kettles + tea in the rooms

my stay was excellent, efficient clean great location.  The service was above and beyond especially from my man Andrew, wanted to give him a special shout out for helping me after a rough day and not only giving me a great list of recommendations around the area but a firm handshake and a free drink ticket which meant the world.  Would recommend to a friend, a coworker, & family, cheers

This has been one of the best hotels I've ever been and it is right next to the Gare de Lyon, which is ideal for travelers. Great hospitality, super friendly staff and good good. It almost seems that everything is possible here. Checking in a bit earlier? No problem. Do you want a late checkout? Also not a problem. There is a bar on the roof where you can sit at the window and you have a great view over Paris and its Eiffel Tower.

The rooms are on the small side but they have everything you need and have a very modern and light interiour. Everything is controllable by a pad and you can find a decent safe under the bed.

When I return to Paris, I will return here again. Thanks for the wonderful stay!

Rooms are spacious compared to standards in Paris and food is deliciousâ¦and the tech is there - amazing and incredible. This is definitely the kind of service that Iâm looking for, guest-oriented with a little funny twist to it. I love it!

Modern and stylish design. Rooms are cosy. Perfect for short work trips. The bar at the top floor offers exquisite cocktails. Downstairs is plenty of space for relaxing after work or before you off to the airport. I will surely be back.

The views from this hotel are absolutely stunning, definitely worth the price. Check in was easy, breakfast was delicious and the staff are so friendly (and also speak good English!) Thoroughly enjoyed my stay, will be back in the future.

Staff very friendly and they speak english! Good location if you are arriving on Gare Du Nord. Metro and Bus station in front of hotel that connects you directly everywhere! Rooms are very modern!

No cash.

Ask for room 1510, you can see Eiffel Tower from your bedð«¶ð½

Awesome hotel. One of the best beds in which I have ever been. Everything can be control with a iPad from the room (regulate temperature, lights, curtains...). To complete all that the shower is also the best shower I have ever seen , big and really comfortable . Totally recommended if you want to visit Paris for a few days.
Merci beaucoup FranÃ§ois

Lovely hotel right next to the Seine. The check in is set up as a DIY but there is always hotel staff present to help you check in. The interior design is very modern cosy. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well maintained. If you get the room with a view you will see the Eiffel Tower and the Notre Dame cathedral when you look outside. Breakfast was good and complete. You can have dinner there as well and the prices are reasonable.

Beautiful modern and stylish hotel located in the heart of Paris. White, red and black are the colors of most things in the room. The rooms are small but high quality. Technology is apparent everywhere. and the impact of this technology is a very interactive and involving experience.

Modern hi-tech design, great style, beautiful room decor, nice location and very friendly staff. We loved everything about staying in this hotel. Oh, and great prices as well!
And I felt in love with stylish photos on the walls of the room and in restaurant!

reat central hotel to explore all of Paris. Check in is strictly 2pm so no early check in by staff were super professional and held our luggage for us. And helped us through the check in electronic process. The rooms were surprisingly roomy with lovely big windows and a view. The bed was probably the best I slept in France. Great technological additions like the ability to cast to the tv. Fast wifi, and cool under bed safe. I liked that this hotel felt ultra modern and wouldn't feel out of place in Tokyo. It was a great change to a lot of musty old French hotels. Location is also unbeatable, just a minutes walk from Gare de Lyon, the area is also great for restaurants, and the scenic walks by the river is beautiful. Breakfast was affordable but also delicious with the best coffee and worth it. I recommend this hotel enough and would stay again in a heartbeat.

A hotel done right, super techy from check-in all the way to the point where you can have mood lighting for your shower!

Super clean and comfy room and the staff were really helpful. Had a beef Ragu from the kitchen and was incredibly nice, far exceeding other hotels' food offerings.

Will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Paris!

This hotel is the best in Paris! It has a superb location and excellent service! I love to give a shout out to Mercy who served us with a smile and gave us a room upgrade. Will definitely come back here when in Paris!

Great customer service. Very prompt.
I loved the room.
The one downer was that you could only pay at the bar using a card as they don't accept cash.

My cousin and his girlfriend stay here. Very nice location. Wont be disappointed. You located by al llm the transportation you'll need. Train, bus, uber and subway. The river which a few different shuttle boat are on is right there. Bakeries and food spots. Theirs a couple bars in the hotel one over looking the river, and I think there is effile tower view. The rooms are all you need spacious enough. I thought it was cool that you could change the mood of your room with a controller. You could go disco, with hopping light and music or romantic. The controller also controller brings tv and I think the airflow. The bathroom is not as private, as its frosted glass doors and well that's about it. But seriously it work, it just depends on who your with.

We booked this because itâs near Gare de Lyon. Checkin is self checkin and thereâs a receptionist always there to help. The process was seamless. The room is very clean and comfortable, shower is great. Thank you.

Extremely comfortable bed. Room is quite small but sufficient. Itâs brightly lit. Breakfast and coffee are very nice. Helpful and friendly staff. Nice dining and co-working area. Would suit people who need space to work for business trips.
Close to Gare du Lyon so well connected with RER, Metro and buses. I would recommend this place.

Outstanding hotel super close to the Gare de Lyon. The check-in and rooms are all controlled through smart technology and offers a comfortable stay in the heart of Paris for a reasonable price.
There are multiple cozy and relaxing lounge areas including a rooftop bar and working desks to catch up on emails with a glass of wine.
CitizenM does not disappoint with very friendly staff who are more than happy to help in both French and English.
Make sure you checkout all that is available at this fantastic hotel next time you are visiting Paris.

A great hotel in the center of Paris on Garde Lion station. The hotel has a modern design, all is activated with an iPad. The room is quite small but perfectly designed. Breakfast is excellent. Highly recommend for singles or couples. The hotel has a pub on the top 16 floor with a great view of the city.

It was perfect. Big shout out to Andrew, at the front desk, and David, at the bar upstairs. Great location just outside of the train station. Just across the bridge if you want to go to a disco at night. Placed along the river to start your walk towards Champ ElyÃ©es. CitizenM, was clean and modernized, with up to date tech for service. I just couldnât get my  iPhone to mirror or chromecast on to the tv to play music, YouTube, or watch a movie from my phone, but I was never in my room. I had an nice view of the Tour Effiel from my room. You just have to experience here for yourself.

for young people its a perfect base to charge from all day. neat compact smart room with insane beds, perfect place to bring potential date. has great starting places to eat and drink, very central to get to many places. looking forward to test more citizenM in other cities. Probably the same, which means excellent (for young! single, friends and couples. not for families. maybe for brief business visits too?)

Love this hotel, the rooms are small but cosy, for me they are just perfect, I don't care about having a huge room as long as I have everything I need, I actually like how the bed is against the wall, makes it super cosy and it's soo comfy!

Everything is done through the iPad which at times can be a little slow or glitchy, but nice to have that control from the side of your bed. The shower is lovely, several settings and mood lighting to make it just right!

Food and drink is a little expensive, but really nice new and exciting brands, that I don't mind spending the extra on trying!

All the staff are friendly and super smiley, I didn't need to use it but being able to get food 24 hours is a nice touch too.

A fantastic hotel! The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were small but all the space was used to itâs maximum to make the room feel comfortable. Everything is controlled by the in room iPad which was easy to use. The hotel is located next to gar de Lyon and the 87 buss takes you to the Eifel tower with the opportunity to jump off to get to Notre Dame too! 100% will use this hotel in the future. The only downside I found was that the breakfast was a limited choice and not really worth the money. my day in Paris was made 100% better thanks to this hotel.

Love the citizenM hotels. The location is very practical for stays in east of Paris. With quick access to subway it gets you to most of Paris within about 20-30 minutes. There is a bar on the top floor that isn't known about a lot. It has an amazing view of Paris (one of the best). Unique view over the river and incredible for sunsets. Rooms aren't all the same (unlike other citizenM's) so pro tip: ask on check-in.

Went to many hotels in France this summer and the one the kids liked most was citizenM in Paris. Although rooms and bathroom is small they present so many nice details, that it is a very good and not expensive choice in Paris center.

The worst citizenM Iâve been to. Location next to the metro somewhat makes up for it. The rooms and hallway seem older. We got a higher room with âscenicâ view but our view was a construction site with barely the river in the background. Our bathroom door didnât close and we had to leave  the room to get each other privacy. We asked twice in one day to get it fixed and they said maintenance would come, which they never did. The 16th floor bar is completely indoor and seems dated as well. The mojito was good though.

Disappointing Experience at a Poorly Managed Hotel

I recently stayed at this hotel and was disappointed. While the location is convenient, the service and attention are far from satisfactory. For a 4-star hotel, the lack of a restaurant or room service is unacceptable.

During our stay, we were having a Starbucks coffee while waiting for a taxi, and the hotel staff pointed out that we were not allowed to consume outside food or beverages on the premises. The irony is that the hotel doesn't even offer a restaurant service if you want to buy one. Such absurd policies are simply outrageous. You can avoid unpleasant experiences by choosing another hotel.

The room was embarrassingly small. The bed is pushed against the wall or window, which means if you are staying with a partner, one of you will have to crawl over the other to get in or out of bed. Cleaning around the mattress and sheets next to the wall is evidently neglected due to the cramped space.

Overall, the location is the only redeeming quality of this hotel. The service, room size, and cleanliness leave much to be desired. I recommend avoiding this hotel to save yourself from a disappointing stay.

Bed bugs and triple charged for taxes.  I stayed in Citizen M a couple of nights, while in Paris in September 2024.  Here are the positives:  Itâs very modern, clean, and well maintained, with a fashionable dining and bar area on the first floor and the sixteenth floor.  The breakfast is pretty good, and the staff are pleasant and helpful.  Overall, itâs a solid four-star hotel, especially for the price.  Here are the negatives.  I have been to over 35 countries and stayed in hotels in all of them; but in this hotel, I was bitten by bed bugs.  They were on the pillow of my bed.  The first night I only had one bite (and didnât know what it was); but on the second night, I had five bites, which grew large and swollen.  One of them was about 50% of the size of a golf ball.  After I left the hotel and went to Germany to see friends, I purchased antihistamine, but it still took a few days for the bites to heal and the swelling to go down.  I have never gotten bed bugs in any of the thousands of hotel rooms and Airbnbâs Iâve stayed in during the course of my life.  Second annoyance: Even though I was a solo traveler, I booked a room with a king-size bed, because Iâm almost two meters tall (6â6â).  Because Citizen M deemed my room to be for two people, even though I was traveling alone, they double charged me for Paris city taxes.  It was a double charge of only 18 euros, but I found it very annoying.  Why should I be charged twice for city taxes, if Iâm only one person?  Citizen M tried to make it up to me by giving me 18 euro in credit for drinks at the bar, but I donât really drink alcohol. Their menu carried a non-alcoholic beer, but they didnât have it in stock, so I thought the coupon wasnât that useful.  BTW, this was my fourth trip to Paris; I always get a king-sized bed since Iâm 6â6â; and Iâve never had this problem at any other Paris hotel.  And, finally, my booking with Agoda included taxes.  I showed Citizen M the booking. So, I paid taxes twice at the hotel and once through Agoda, so I ended up triple paying for taxes.  Because of the foregoing problems, the best I can give this place is two stars. Had I not been triple charged for taxes and gotten bed bugs, I would have given Citizen M five stars.

Conveniently located near Gare de Lyon station, the hotel is very easy to find and navigate. It's a partial service hotel with self check-in. There are staff to support but what they can do is more limited (help you with directions/recommendations around Paris, food and amenity orders, etc.)

The hotel has a sleek and artsy look and feel, but it does feel that it's simply using these design/brand quirks to cover up the fact that it's not a full-service hotel. It's not that much cheaper than some full-service alternatives.

The rooms are a bit small but more or less clean. Everything is operated via a tablet which is cool at first but becomes gimmicky later. Their app has bugs (we didn't have any TV channels for some time), and for some reason, guests are not able to turn off the room air conditioning. You can only lower fans and the max temp is only 24 degrees Celsius. For some, this can still be too cold and make someone ill.

As they probably have less staff on-site as a partial service hotel, no one ever picked up the phone whenever we called when we were outside the hotel and needed some help which was very disappointing.

While overall not the worst experience, and some cool quirks, at the end of the day, would not recommend staying here unless you get a really good deal or are specifically looking for this kind of experience.

Location was fantastic. Room was clean on arrival. Staff will not allow you to consume any food or beverage in the common areas. There is a lobby area with chairs, couches and tables for guests. We were told we could not consume our Starbucks or any other food/beverage item in that location unless we purchased it in their separate restaurant. We were asked to leave and go to our room.

Not the best choice we could have made.

I guess cleaning itâs an issue in this hotel, housekeeping was terrible, one day they totally forgot to clean our room, hallways and elevators are dirty, and as absolute climax the second night we stayed in, we saw a rat sneaking around the restaurant while we were eating,
For the price that weâve paid and the 4 stars that they claim itâs unacceptable.

Spend your money somewhere else.

Unfortunately, I do not share the positive reviews on this hotel.

The rooms are really narrow, almost too small for two people. Finding a simple trash can was not available/unclear for us. No cooking pot for teas and by default no extra water in the room. Minibar was empty. See-through shower stall walls, lack of toilet isolation and lack of hygiene spray for going to the toilet - not suitable when in a room with a friend or even as a couple. Very uncomfortable. Insufficient opportunity for fresh air, even with ventilation in the room.

Netflix and other apps are not pre installed on the TV. The connection was not possible on the TV via an iPhone, neither via Airplay nor Chromecast, despite instructions, so practically unusable. Who wants to watch random tv broadcast in 2023?

Upsides: The staff was superb. Nice and always helpful!
Room-wise, I liked the iPad and the settings options with the light and temperature above it. The bed was comfortable and overall the room was clean.

However, I would not stay longer than one night and will not return for the given price of 130â¬Â for two people for one night, no breakfast included, check-in by 2, check-out by 11.

2.5 stars of 5

The rooms are the smallest that i have every seen, hardly fitting a double bed, and no place to even walk without hitting something.

The bathrooms are again so small that if you don't open a shower door, you really cannot get in the bathroom.

You have to prebook cleaning.

The room is controlled by an ipad. If you are 5 year old, you may love the colored lights.

The breakfast has orange and apple juice, scrambled egg, bacon and roasted potatos.

The location is very good as its next to a train station.

Staff is generally good, but you won't be able to get anyone on the phone after 9 pm.

Their is no tea/coffee in the room.

Lifts are Well maintained and clean.

Its a city hotel so no fancy views.

I really really wish I could give this place a positive review because Paris was amazing and the staff were so nice but we had to move rooms 3 times because the door knobs kept breaking and we were approved for a late checkout of 6 PM because our train didnât leave until 7:30 but we got a call at 4 PM saying they needed us to leave ASAP because they were at 100% occupancy and need to flip the room.

Wanted to love it, but couldnât.

After arriving in an absolutely awful AirBnB in Paris late at night and after a lot of unnecessary stress, thanks to my boyfriend we managed to get a room in citizenM Paris - Gare de Lyon. The hotel is simply beautiful and very modern. Before we arrived I felt like I could have cried but when we arrived at citizenM I felt I couldnât have been more lucky. We arrived at the hotel quite late at night and the staff were all lovely and accommodating and very understanding of our situation. Our hotel room was lovely qnd kept up with the modern theme of the hotel. Due to the fact we got there so late at night we decided to have some food in the restaurant at the hotel which was just lovely. We had a really comfortable first night in the hotel, the bed was luxuriously comfy and the bed linen was of a high quality. When we arrived back to the hotel after our first day exploring Paris there was a drinks voucher waiting for us in our room from the hotel due to the poor experience and stress we had had with the Airbnb. This was completely unexpected and we felt the staff at citizenM went above and beyond to make our stay there special seeing as it got off to such a bad start. It was expensive to stay there but we got what we paid for. The hotel was clean, modern and very cool with all the technical features. I love how the rooms are controlled by the MoodPad, lighting, curtains, television etc. I would definitely stay in another citizenM hotel because we absolutely loved it and we were blown away by the great customer service! CitizenM is such a cool hotel chain! We had a total of 2 nights in the citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon Hotel.

This was our 5th hotel from CitizenM chain and we werenât disappointed. Great location; sparkly clean smart room; cool living room ambience; delicious food and drinks; amazing staff: super friendly, helpful & attentive! Weâll definitely come back again!

This is a really nice hotel just round the corner from Gare de Lyon.
There are 12 floors of accommodation, all of which have the super-cool CitizenM smart room controls. The bed is really comfortable and the bathroom has a great shower.
The staff are really friendly.
The view from the 16th-floor bar is fantastic: you can see across all of Paris and have a stunning view of the sunset behind La DÃ©fense.
The breakfast has a huge variety and freshly-made coffee: exactly what you need to start the day.

My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon.
From the friendly and helpful people at the front desk to housekeeping to the cafeteria staff, My stay was warm and very comfortable.

I was intrigued by their self checkin and checkout style. Their clean and compact smart rooms, the contemporary design of the hotel and the way every space in the hotel tells a different story.

Breakfast was really good, their cafeteria food is also really nice, I also love how take-out isnt restricted. Did I mention the lovely view of paris from my room or the beautiful view from the sky lounge on the 16th floor? Breath taking!

All in all, I had the best time in Paris and citizenM paris had a lot to do with that. Check them out guysððð¼

Absolutely amazing! I have stayed at a lot of different types of hotels around the world, but the experience at CitizenM was like none other. Very modern/high-tech, somewhat quirky design, staying at CitizenM was an experience in and of itself. Would highly recommend.

This is what happens when intelligence and style meet.   Compact rooms, though filled to perfection with a king bed and leading technologies.    Paris cool rooftop bar,  excellent 24hr cafe,  Modern Art everywhere, Happy people working for them.  A+

Great, modern with a friendly staff hotel. A true XXI century experience :) Breathtaking view over Paris from the Sky Bar!
A rail & metro station just 2 minutes walk from the hotel, getting to the centre doesn't take longer than 10 minutes with a train. 25 minutes walking distance to Notre Dame along the Seine.
Will definitely be back, once in Paris!

Very nice. Good location.
Modern decor, professional staff. Nice bar, but not cheap. Great views from the 16th floor.
Hi tech rooms, an iPad controls everything.
A nice touch: no adaptors needed for anybody (see picture).
Good value for money

Love citizenM concept which suits my travel lifestyle. More important the reception staff has been excellent. I stayed at both CDG and Gare Lyon location and ALL the reception staff have been excellent. Special shout out for Mercy and Isabelle ( Gare Lyon team) who help us when we check in and check out. Thank you citizenM.

Very modern & stylish with quirky art in common spaces.
Room was clean & very comfortable. Great shower.
Only issue was the door to the room needed a hefty shove to open.

The people are very fun and friendly.
The room are great! With (colour-) light you could regular by yourself. ð¤©
Crazy mercy is a very fun girl who made your stay great!
I had one of the best stays in France after a long time. Emma, Noor and Hannah made the whole experience really pleasant! CitizenM is now my go to hotel whenever I visit Paris.

Bit of a dodgier part of town (near train station is typically like that) but price was 1/2 that of the Champs ÃlysÃ©es one and perfect for arriving/leaving by train.  Some great restaurants around there that are not incredibly expensive as many might be.

Nice hotel with hight tech clean rooms. The ability to control the TV, blinds, and lighting in the room all with the provided iPad is very amazing and convient. The only thing to note is that it seems to be located in business area with mostly office buildings around so you will have to travel if you want to eat or shop. Still, it is a good hotel as it is within walking distance of metro station where you can easily travel to the famous locations in Paris.

We've stayed at a couple of CitizenM's and they're all wonderfull! So much luxury for a reasonable price. The soft beds en plush pillows are just sooo comfy. The staff is always incredibly friendly and the breakfast is super elaborate.

Newly constructed hotel in renovated building very close to Gare de Lyon. Friendly, helpful staff. Funky lounge and bar/restaurant areas. Guest lounge on the top floor is lovely too - and has great views over Paris.

Fantastic hotel. Clean, efficient, great amenities,  pleasant atmosphere . The staff is friendly, professional   and helpful with great suggestions. The location was perfect for getting around  Paris. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a very pleasant stay in Paris.
Very comfortable. Good service. Easy check-in. High tech rooms with fun tablet to play with. We were also able to leave our luggages there for the day, after checking out.

This CitizenM hotel gave us more of a hostel impression rather than of a 4 star hotel.

Weâve been assigned a room which had a lock forced, even though the door would close, part of the wood and paint were crashed/missing from the door. Later we found out that the previous guests suffered an intent of a robbery.

There were no amenities in the room, the reservation indicated a daily bottle of water which was nowhere to be seen. No cups or glasses to put our toothbrushes. Uncomfortable.

We booked a higher floor City View room, but windows need to be clean to actually enjoy the view. When the sun came through the window we could see so much dust in the room, even though we requested a cleaning through an app for one of the days, the room remained dusty.

At the cloudM the bartender was rude. The reception ambassador explained that we could order food at the canteenM on their first floor and take it to clouldM where we bought the drinks. The bartender called Benjamin told we couldnât have the food there since âthe concept was differentâ, there were only 3 people at the cloudM for a reason. He also tried to overcharge us for the beers we ordered.

At night, you can hear the doors slam at the rooms next door. During our last night there we couldnât sleep, since some of the guests partied throughout the night, coming in and out, slamming doors at 4am.

Overall I am giving it 2 stars because McKenzie at the reception was nice during the check-in and the bed is comfortable. But the experience was very different from the Amsterdam CitizenM hotel where I stayed years ago. What a disappointment.

Hello Thomas,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

We are sorry to learn about the technical issues you encountered with TV and the blinds. Even though exceptional, unfortunately it can happen that technology fails.We  apologize for the inconvenience caused. Our team of ambassadors is available to support 24h/7 and look for solutions to make our guestsâ stay more comfortable. Have you reported it to our team during your stay?

Our technicians are looking into it to avoid this type of unpleasant experience for our guests in the future. Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

Kind regards,
Maria & citizenM team

This hotel had great potential. However, three things spoiled my stay. First, my âroom with a viewâ was only halfway up the hotel, meaning the view was rather less spectacular than I expected. Second, all the windows had fly mesh fitted on the outside (despite not actually opening). This ruined all my attempts to take photos of the view. Third, due to coronavirus, the large breakfast buffet was replaced by a really poor âbreakfast in a bagâ worth maybe 3â¬. But they still charged me the full rate. So, I ended up paying extra for a bad view and a bad breakfast. Oh, and they overcharged me on arrival and Iâm still awaiting a refund for the difference.

Hello citizen Philippe,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay . We are happy to learn that  you found the room tidy and our decor.
We are sorry to learn that you were debited twice. After looking into what happened, we saw that you made 2 reservations for the same day. You checked in into one of the reservation and the other reservation became a no show which was charged.

We apologise that the view was not to your liking. Our ambassadors are always available for solutions, including a room change for  a better view should you request for it.
Please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can help with.

CitizenM team

I like the concept and didnât mind the small space because I was traveling solo. The staff were all very friendly too.  But I canât recommend this place because:

-Terrible sound proofing. I heard footsteps from neighboring rooms and doors slamming all night. I switched to another room and had the same problems. I had to take sleeping pills to fall asleep.

-Uncleanliness. There was dust and hair on the floor and in the corners of the bed. They also didnât change my sheets even after I left a note on the pillow asking them to (in French and English).

-The windows donât open, which adds to the feeling of claustrophobia.

-Breakfast is overpriced and the buffet has a very limited selection. The croissants were good though.

-The location is not great.  The proximity to Gare de Lyon train station is the only redeeming quality.

Overall, the experience felt gimmicky. I was glad to check out after spending 6 nights here.
Television lose signal each 10 min. The I pod did not work. 337 euro for a mini room well I had more for less. Good point all is clean
Rooms are tiny, especially for over 300euro per nite. No bottled water or coffee making facilities in the room.
No bathrobes, no teakettle, cleaning twice a week only and the TV was not working many times. Not bad but itâs not worth 4 stars.
Like a backpackers or student hostel, with the price of a 5* resort.

I totally Don t recommend this hotel, I was in a honey moon and I called the hotel to do special arrangements they promised everything about this but when I ve arrived the room was normal, really bad experience, the workers really unfriendly with the exception of Jorge that is really nice.
Nice hotel because its near the train station. However, the rooms is very small
A bit dated now - and lacking in some facilities. For the price, better can be found.
its motel. small rooms. no facilities
Good luck with garr de Lyon

HÃ´tel avec du personnel uniquement anglophone, dâoÃ¹ la grande difficultÃ© Ã  se faire comprendre pour des francophones
Bar plus beau que fourni, pas de quoi se dÃ©tendre avec un bon verre de spiritueux le soir (choix trÃ¨s limitÃ©)
Les chambres sont ridiculement petite avec un lavabo au milieu de la piÃ¨ce et des cabines douche/toilettes en verre dÃ©poli (oubliez toute intimitÃ©)
Ãa nâest pas le meilleur rapport qualitÃ© prix sur le secteur de la Gare de Lyon

Hotel with English-speaking staff only, making it very difficult for French speakers to make themselves understood.
The bar is more beautiful than it is stocked, no place to relax with a good glass of spirits in the evening (very limited selection).
The rooms are ridiculously small, with a sink in the middle of the room and frosted glass shower/toilet stalls (forget about any privacy).
It's not the best value for money in the Gare de Lyon area.

This place has exceeded my expectation! Had an amazing stay in this hotel with a great value for money. The photos in their website is what you will expect to see once you arrive.. clean, modern and comfy. I also like that it's very accesible to train station (5mind walk) and a bus stop (1min) so it's easy to go to anywhere in Paris. It is also close to some shops and the hotel has it's own bar in 1st flr and 16th flr (open until 1am) which is dope! Also, the coolest thing is, the Ipad..it controls almost everything in the room.. the mood lights, temperature, TV, curtains etc! The lounge area is also well styled and very spacious.
Only suggestion is that the hotel provide some  electric kettle and coffee/tea! Other than that, everything was superb! I will definitely come back to this place everytime I visit Paris!
Amazing room and service for a great price! I love the theme of the hotel and the bed nook. The room controller was very fun to play with! Definitely plan to stay there again!

I was really in love with this Hotel and wish I could have stayed there for ever. The room can be controlled via an iPad which you have in the room. From different light options to Controlling the Mood lights and colours. U can control the Air conditioning temperature etc from it, switch the tv on and off and browse the channels and movies and local guides from the ipad.  Control the curtains and blinds to go up and down.  I would happily stay in one of the rooms as my home if could.
Check in was really easy u can do it from the reception. U also have access to the lounge and bars and the one at the very top has nice views of Paris.
They have access to PCs and if you are needing to print out tickets etc u have a printer available.
The shower was also amazing. I was never out of it.
I was really amazed by this hotel and would definitely stay in another CitizenM as my first choice.
Oh u get a really cute citizen M teddy / pillow that was soo cute which u have on ur bed when u arrive and is really cute and now i wish i got one to take home.....

Also it is right beside the Gare de Lyon station so u can get the tram or train to anywhere. We went to Disneyland Paris and just got the train and it was only Â£15 return and we also got the train to the airport and saved ourselves money on a taxi/uber.
This hotel is really in a great location and will make ur stay in Paris more enjoyable.
Excellent hotel near the Seine on walking distance from Gare de Lyon and le Marais. The staff is excellent and very friendly. Nice relaxing atmosphere and good bar on the 16th Floor. Recommended!
Good atmosphere, close to metro, high tech equipment, spacious rooms, and attentive staff made our stay here very worthwhile.

Best hotel staff EVER!  We travelled to Paris as a surprise for our daughter's birthday, and the staff truly went out of their way to make her weekend extra special!  I highly recommend CitizenM hotels, in general--but the Gare de Lyon staff went above and beyond with their hospitality.  The management and corporate leadership should certainly recognize how excellent their employees are!  We look forward to future stays at the Gare de Lyon CitizenM.

I'm a massive fan of the CitizenM chain. For a chain the hotels are really personal. Totally free movies as we as TV (inc. BBC1) and radio channels available. Rooms have a huge double bed, one of the comfiest beds I've slept in. Good soundproofing in the rooms also.

Location is definitely the best. Only a block to the train station and several metro lines on hand. Maybe the problem was my long one week staying there. A day shouldn't be a problem.

I did not like how small the room is. They told you that the room has ironing facilities. That is not true; there is an ironing room on the floor but not in the room. I asked for a kettle and could not get it. I have a baby and needed to prepare milk for her. I needed hot water.  The iconic view from my room was catastrophic and not iconic. I asked FranÃ§ois for a better room and even chatted to a staff via booking.com but nothing doing. No follow up was made on the matter. When we checked in, no valet services were provided, we had to take our luggage to our room by ourselves. It is not easy after a 13 hours flight. The laundry service (outsourced) is just a scam in my opinion.  The staff doesn't speak FRENCH. I ASKED FRANCOIS AND HE SAID NO.

Pros
Nice location

Comfortable mattress
Staff very friendly

Cons
Small room
Small bed
Hand washing basin inside room
No cupboard
No kettle nor slippers and many stuff that should be there for a 4 star hotel

Generally value for money losing

My wife and I stayed there 3 weeks ago and we were shivering eventhough we were under the blanket as the room temp was still not warm enough for us during winter. For travellers who need a warmer room, this hotel is not for you. Otherwise, hotel is great.

This hotel felt more like an upmarket hostel to me. Itâs very hard to understand the 4 star rating. My room was relatively clean in terms of the bed and bathrooms, but the other surfaces and walls were stained in a way that made it overall feel dirty. The hallway carpets and lifts were super unclean throughout my stay and the lobby smelled like a canteen. The rooms are small but thatâs clear at the point of booking - it just seemed to me like it would be small but super clean and functional. You also have to go to the canteen to get water, thereâs none in the room. This isnât a huge deal but contributed to the overall budget, rather than luxury feeling.

Pros are itâs very close to the train station, staff were helpful and friendly and it was quite sound proof from outside (3rd floor exterior room).

I suppose itâs hi-tech in that you check yourself in and out, and the blinds are electronic, but thatâs not really too unusual these days. You can only have either all the lights in the room on or all off, which was kind of strange, given thereâs a bedside lamp. The WiFi was very slow when I used it and ended up using my phoneâs network to stream instead.

Itâs nothing terrible but for me wasnât worth the price and their branding as âaffordable luxuryâ makes no sense as it isnât luxurious at all (and doesnât even feel like theyâre trying to be).

Ottimo come sempre. L'esperienza con l'ambassador Maddy qualcosa di veramente unica difficile da trovare in qualsiasi altra struttura alberghiera.

Standart between Ikea and Apple. Shine bright with poor quality. no, price over 140. â¬ per day are not realistic. Room equipement not functional. i had one request, to clean the armchair from long femal black hairs (i have very short hair). After 3 days the problem was still not solved! Various Staff members cud not deal with. Room was very cold, allways at 21c. They advert grean, safe the planet saving energy but freeze the rooms at 21c, even itâs cold outside. I call that hipocrisy.

A bit disappointing for the price payed. Rooms are very very very small, but clean.
The toilet door does not close properly so there is no privacy between couples sharing the room. Also no vent so smell and humidity takes over the room when bathroom is used.
iPad controls lights, shades and temperature which can be seen as cool but it does not enhance the stay if you ask me.
Breakfast was not outstanding but good.

Far away from the attractions of the city. Pleasant staff, good variety of breakfast. The room is too small and needs more cleaning attention. We choose room in the eleventh floor in order to avoid the noice but it was very noisy. We stayed three nights and no one visited our room in order to be cleaned.

The bed and the sheet were very confortable, the room was spotless and they also have a very friendly staff.

Though, I was disappointed by several things given that it is a 4 stars hotel :
- you can't open the window
- there was no body lotion
- no possibility to prepare a tea or coffee in the room nor a bottle of water in the fridge
- the shower pressure was really too low, making it very difficult to rinse off the shampoo
- breakfast was not particularly good

PROS: Great location and amicable stuff. Breakfast was very nice and offered many options.
CONS: rooms are very tiny for a not as tiny price, yeah, very technological and all with your own ipad for controlling the room, but you are paying â¬200+/night for changing the color of the lights in your room and a good location. the bathroom is in the same room as the bed and there's barely space for anything. I don't think I would repeat the whole citizenM experience.

Nicely updated modern rooms with an iPad that can be used as a smart remote to control everything (ac, lights, tv,blinds). The only downside to this hotel is the size of the rooms, but I believe the room size is about average compared to most hotels in Paris. The staff was multilingual and check in and check out was easy. We had some minor problem with the sink draining water very slowly. The top floor bar had a good view of the river and the drinks were excellent. Overall, the location is good and I might book a visit again.

I have stayed with citizenM earlier also so I know what I can expect there. My experience this time was absolutely bad. Timing was bad too as there was a failure in water heating system and there was no hot water during peak hours of the day.

In a world of universal plugs there are European plugs every where and no USB connectors also. They disabled American plug point not sure why.

No one came to clean the room. They have put a eloborate process of requesting to clean the room a day in advance. Who has time to check all those things?

As usual the team was helpful, proactive and energetic. Food and drinks in the bar are really good.

It's a good hotel in a excellent location (just 5 min walking from Gare de Lyon). The rooms are small but cozy, with an excellent bed and shower. However, my wife and I didn't like that much of the room cleanness, there was always some dust on the floor. A bit annoying. The iPad to control room in the beginning is cool but too much technology can be troublesome. Why do simple curtains need to be controlled by an iPad? Sometimes it didn't work well.
The living area is superb and super well design, we love it spent time there! As well the bar area, with good drinks and well priced. But the food choices aren't great and we got disappointed with them. We witnessed a lot of people bringing their own food or ordering it through apps.
In general we recommend the hotel and we hope to return in another opportunity.

Same good setup - modern rooms, comfortable beds, designer furniture.
Unfortunately you cannot consume outside food in their so called living room area.
Their breakfast buffet is rather limited for vegetarians and very small for vegans.

This is a decent hotel but I am not sure if its a 4 star to the standard it claims as the room does not include complementary tea and kettle services in the room for the price one pays. I would like to thank the staff member who was kind enough to offer tea and drinks for free on the first day. Otherwise overall experience was decent.

Good staff attitude. However, we arrived early morning due to the train demonstration, we were trapped for three hours and arrived at 4 am next morning yet they didnât even consider to give us any sort of discount. I must say that the room was extremely small, one sided bed so i had to crawl every night to use the toilet. No place to have my suit case. I am used to Paris space limits, bit this is too much especially for the money we paid. Check out time is 11 or else you have to pay extraâ¦ they use technology to control every aspect of the room, check in and check out. Lights, blinds, AC ex

It's ok but not amazing, for the money you pay for it I'd expect more.

Rooms are small with the WC separated by a plastic wall so, if you want privacy this type of layout is not for you.
Everything in the room is controlled by an iPad,  including the multi-coloured shower lights which gives the room a 1980's cheesy  feeling (bad taste if you ask me).

The breakfast is ok with a variety of yogurts, hot and cold food but nothing is organic and if you are not early you won't have fresh food.

Why is it so popular? Because it has the hype of other citizenM hotels around the world, vibrant deco, designer chairs and loud marketing. This particular location is popular with business men (so be prepared to see lots of them), it's right outside one of the main stations in Paris so easy access to public transport.

I gave it 3 stars for its location and the staff. They are actually really helpful. Otherwise I'm afraid it would only be a 2 stars review from me as it's not value for money.

We had stayed in better citizenM's in other cities. This one looked very basic, the reception area reminded me of a youth hostel. In the bedrooms, the windows are very small compared to the long, wide windows in other citizenM's. So the view to the Eiffel was disappointing.The location is great for metros, trains and buses but unfortunately there are a lot of beggars and homeless people in the area so it feels very rundown. Night time doesn't feel very safe in that area.

The hotel is very stylish, processes very digitalized and staff is very friendly. Excellent location right next to Gare de Lyon.  Unfortunately, in my room the water tab was ripped out of the sink, the toilet would not flush properly and nearly no water pressure for the shower. Clearly too many issues for a hotel in this price class.
Good rooms, amenities and services, but the windows are blocked with stickers, so after paying extra for a room on high floor for a view of Paris, it was disappointing.

I've never stayed at a Citizen M hotel before so cannot compare this to any of their other hotels. I found this particular one great for the fancy extras, ie self check in which avoids standing in queues, free up to date in room film selection, ipad in room, continental, US and UK in room plug sockets but very disappointing on the basics. In terms of the basics, I have two bones of contention. Firstly, although I was able to access the in room films I was unable to access any TV channels. When I selected the TV guide on the TV, it claimed to be loading, 20 minutes later, still loading.... I informed a member of staff the next morning who stated that someone would have a look at this, when I came in that evening, still loading......! It does not appear that anyone had rectified the issue or bothered to inform me what was going on. Second bone of contention is the coffee situation at breakfast. The bar where breakfast is available has a fancy pants coffee machine for those wanting cappuccino etc at breakfast. For those who would like a bog standard Americano, there is a flask of coffee available- 1 small flask for a bar that probably has a capacity of up to 150 people. Day 1, I gave staff my room number as breakfast was included and then got my food and drink--the flask was empty, as I saw a staff member take this away I was expecting it to be returned in a few minutes. 10-15 minutes later, still no coffee, I asked the girl by the coffee machine for an Americano due to the situation--I was informed that I would have to go to the front of the bar where I gave my room number to request for this-really unnecessary considering I had given her my room number earlier and she was already aware that everything was paid for. At this point a member of staff turned up with the flask, which didn't work! I waited another 5 minutes and then had to leave as I had to get to an appointment, so no coffee at breakfast. The rest of my trips to the bar for breakfast turned into a ridiculous ritual of firstly checking if there was coffee in the flask (zero every morning, no matter what time I was there) before giving my room number and requesting a coffee from the machine to avoid multiple trips to the front of the bar. Not a good situation for those who like a coffee at breakfast! I would have given this place 3.5 out of 5 but wasn't prepared to round up to a 4 as it didn't make the grade. The hotel is in a good location by the Gare de Lyon with great number of metro and RER lines available and the rooms are very clean, however I found the 2 mentioned issues a let down.

A CitizenM like all others, just beware half the rooms will have a back alley view (pic). You're much better off in CitizenM La DÃ©fense, which by the way offers a lower rate. This location is always superfull, personnel very stressed out; if this is your first CitizenM experience, you might think it's ****. And yes, half the employees don't speak French.

Great location for Garre du Lyon. Very helpful staff that can speak lots of languages.

Standard type rooms for a CitizenM. The tablet room control can be a bit of a pain.

There is a bar on the 16th floor.

Not the best CitizenM that I have stayed at, but still good! Made a last minute reservation in November and was able to check in same day. The room was a little beat up, had to move because the sink wasnât draining. The building is also a bit odd because it is a converted office building. Windows are small but have a nice view.

Citizen M located next to Paris Gare de Lyon station making movements within Paris so much easier. The hotel staff made the check-in process so easy and took advantage at minimal cost to upgrade to a higher floor with view of the station. Room was clean and use of technology to control light and TV more fun.

Loved the hotel, room spacious. Wished to have bedside tables or a shelf both sides as we both wear glasses. Staff so friendly and helpful. Right next to the train station. Easy to get around. Not too far to walk to food places. You can see the Eiffel tower from the 16th floor bar. Breakfast was a bit expensive for what it was. You can get free filtered water from the bar to take to your room or top up your bottle. They have nice lounge areas.

This was our second stay at this location. This time we had a total of 3 rooms.  The hotel is conveniently located and within walking distance of several restaurants. The majority of the staff were very helpful. The restaurant and bar were both outstanding.
The only opportunity was the rooms. We booked higher floor rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower, which all three had. One of our rooms was handicap accessible for my mother, which worked out great. Surprisingly, the other room, which was next door, was also roomier. Our third room was on another floor and was a standard size. When we went downstairs to see if any other corner rooms were available (was willing to pay for upgrade), the lady at the front desk explained that all of the rooms were the same size and only the layout is different. There was a clear difference in the sizes. We can understand if she'd taken the approach that no other corner rooms were available, but it was sorta insulting to insist that all of the rooms are the exact same size.

This hotel was great for what we needed (which was a clean, comfortable, conveniently located place while we explore the city all day). Itâs kind of like a private room in a nice hostel. The location was so convenient, close to train stations and the Seine. Lots of cafes nearby. Check in is super easy and efficient, and the staff were extremely friendly. The room itself is pocket-sized but has everything you need. The bed is super cozy and blackout curtains make it a great place to recoup after travelling. The room has a small fridge (like, very small) and nice bath products. Make sure whoever you travel with to this hotel you are super comfortable with as the bathroom is a glass box. As another reviewer mentioned, if you have large luggage this room would be a challenge. The lobby bar is great - we went for breakfast each day (not the buffet, you could go and get a croissant or pain au chocolat and proper espresso machine coffee for under 5â¬). Itâs a really great space (for breakfast and a drink). The food menu for later in the day is strange - we thought we would go one night but ended up elsewhere instead. The rooftop bar is really cool and you can see the Eiffel Tower, very cool at night. Overall Iâd stay here again for the great service, clean room, convenient location and price was decent.

Very small room (not unusual I understand for Paris) but important to note if you are traveling with full suitcases there is basically no room for them. Rooms clean, bed and pillows comfortable.  Nice and helpful staff. Great location near the river. Close to Gare De Lyon station making train and metro and bus nearby. Tiny bathroom clearly inserted into room no vent. Nice rain shower head. Our view from window in photo.

This hotel is located at walking distance from Gare de Lyon railway station. The rooms are average in size and compactly arranged. All the basic amenities are present in the room. This hotel offers self check in and check out. The hospitality of the staff is the best part of this hotel. It also has restaurant and working area within the premises.

with the price and the location, i'm fine with the level of hygiene (some dust in the room, poor air quality which made my nose running but we'll let it slide) and facilities for the room (tech-enabled), bars and restaurants residing in the hotel.
Staff were friendly. mostly an automated checkin process. close to the station, but still not easy to nagivate if you have lots of luggage, its close but not that close.

The rooms are small with little extra space to move around, but the location is excellent, being close to public transport. Cristina and the team were fantastic, and we received outstanding service and support from the staff overall.

Our stay was pleasant and location was ideal as we had metro lines in walkable distance  and we had easy access to all popular places. Rooms very small,  okay for two people as we stayed out most of the time.

Very conveniently located near Gare de Lyon for SNCF or the Paris Subway. Less than 100 yards to the Seine and views of the Eiffel Tower from many rooms.
Rooms are somewhat smaller than the average American hotel room but have most of the same amenities. Our room had no drawers for storage so living out of two suitcases on a long trip was a bit awkward. One interesting feature is the iPad by the bed. It controls everything from the TV to day curtains, night shades, lights, mood lighting and housekeeping requests.
The bar and dining areas can best be described as eclectic. Staff are multi national and I was quite surprised to have a Chinese Australian greeting me in French at the bar.

No kettle in room and no galley/kitchen on floor, had to go down to reception for hot water
Only a few channels on the tv, everything relies on streaming, poor controls
No usb ports

Superb staff with delegated authority
Clean and comfy bed
Excellent shower and toiletries
Not luxurious but a nice space if you are on the go! Great central location in Gare del Lyon.

When I'm travelling for shoots I usually stay in CitizenM. They're solid quality for how reasonably priced they are, comfortable and clean. The rooms are tiny but for solo travel it's not an issue and I find them cosy. They have the basic amenities I need (hair dryer, mini fridge, canteen and bar) and the beds are comfy.
This one had a couple issues- the tv didn't work and the air-conditioning rattled all night, but aside from that, I had a good stay and always use them for my city breaks.
The Gard du Nord one is well located, right on the river with beautiful views and a lot within walking distance.

Pros: The room is small but practical, the rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable, the breakfast is very good, the croissants are excellent, the luggage drop service is very good, the staff are very helpful, good location.
Cons: the windows are very small and the view is facing the other buildings, the room is suffocating, it would be nice to open the windows, the air conditioner is automatic and cannot be turned off, it gets cold inside, airless.
Excellent CitizenM. Rooms have a fridge and decor is still fresh. Good selection of cocktails in the sky bar and very obliging waiter who showed me how to make my Blueberry Bliss :)
The staff are friendly and try their best to help the customers
Excellent locale and great staff
