CitizenM Paris Gare de Lyon offers much of what I have come to appreciate about the brand: thoughtful design, genuinely friendly service, and clever use of space. My stay here delivered a strong overall experience with some standout highlights, though it did not begin without its hiccups.||||Booking Experience: Appreciated Transparency After Pricing Drop||||As someone who works in the travel industry, I am fully aware of dynamic pricing strategies. Still, I was surprised when the nightly rate for my room dropped dramatically on the day of arrival by more than would usually be expected even for a last minute rate shift. It admittedly left a bit of a sour taste, especially after booking well in advance.||||To their credit, the hotel team handled it brilliantly. Upon arrival, the staff and the on duty manager graciously allowed me to cancel and rebook the same room on the spot at the new lower rate. Their flexibility and professionalism turned what could have been a frustrating moment into a positive one, and I am very grateful for their help.||||Room and View: Cozy with a Parisian Postcard Backdrop||||My room followed the typical citizenM template: compact, efficient, and tech forward, with all controls accessible via a tablet or the mobile app. The oversized bed was just as comfortable as I have come to expect, and everything was immaculate.||||What made this stay especially memorable was the view. I had a picture perfect window overlooking the Paris skyline, with the Eiffel Tower sparkling in the distance each night. It was a small luxury that added a real sense of place and made the stay feel special.||||On this trip, we were also celebrating my partnerâs birthday, and the hotel surprised us with a thoughtful handwritten card. That personal touch was very much appreciated and speaks volumes about the care and attention the staff provide.||||Facilities and Public Spaces: Stylish and Well Kept||||Unlike some of the older citizenM locations, this property still feels fresh and well maintained. The design throughout the public spaces was sleek and vibrant with the kind of atmosphere that encourages both solo relaxation and social interaction. Everything felt clean, well kept, and in working order.||||The rooftop bar was a lovely surprise: stylish and offering panoramic views across Paris. While fully enclosed so do not expect a terrace, it is still a great space to enjoy a drink and soak in the skyline. The ambience leans more quiet lounge than buzzing cocktail bar, which suited me just fine.||||Service: Truly a Standout||||As always with citizenM, the staff or âambassadorsâ were one of the best parts of the experience. Warm, engaging, and genuinely helpful, they managed to make every interaction feel personal without ever being intrusive. Whether helping me rebook at check in or offering advice on the local area, their hospitality was top notch.||||Location: Excellent Connections but a Bit Gritty After Dark||||The hotelâs location right next to Gare de Lyon is ideal for travelers arriving by train or wanting quick access to the metro. From here, it is incredibly easy to get to just about anywhere in the city. That said, the surrounding area, while busy and practical by day, can feel a bit rough around the edges at night. It is worth being mindful if you are returning late.||||Final Thoughts: Great Stay with a Strong Recovery||||CitizenM Paris Gare de Lyon delivered exactly the kind of experience I associate with the brand: comfortable, efficient, and warm, all in a stylish package. While the dynamic pricing stumble at the beginning threw me off, the way the staff handled it turned things around completely. Combined with a memorable view, friendly service, and a well kept property, the stay turned out to be a highlight.||||If you are a fan of the citizenM experience or simply looking for a well located modern hotel with excellent transport links and a human touch, this property is absolutely worth considering. I will happily return, especially for that Eiffel Tower view.

looked different from pictures,â¦ estate is on the slightly older side and rooms are not as sizeable as imagined. lifts are tough to operate, requires holding the door open before you can step in, and itâs really cramped too (2 pax + 2 luggages). to get to the lift there is a small flight of stairs. room doors are light and not too sound proof. however, hotel is good location from major train station Lyon perrache where you can select if coming in from paris.

The layout of the bed is landscape and could not straighten my legs have to shift. The room is controlled by smart system. You just need to use iPad to control air conditioning and lights and even night mode

We are returning guests. We liked it more before because there are a lot of construction work around. New buildings popping up around, closing the view. Inside everything is like before, clean and OK.||
Had some issues with the heating in my room(s), but overall the hotel is great âÂ modern and techie, the staff is very helpful so it's a great experience.

We stayed for 3 days here. We took the breakfast also and it was good. Lot of options. Location was very nice as it was easier to leave to any place. The train station and bus stop was very near.
Also the staff was very polite and helpful. The roof top restaurant we watched the Eiffel tower at night also. It was beautiful and overall stay was quiet comfortable.

First experience at CitizenM, and not the last. I understand and partially agree with some of the other reviewerâs challenges with this hotel (bed size/arrangement, room ipad, check-in). However, if you understand what youâre signing up for it can be a great experience and value.

We stayed for 5 nights. The room was super quiet and well insulated from sound. Making the room pitch black with the touch of the ipad button was great for getting over jet lag. The bed was immensely comfortable, and the temperature controls were perfect. There were some minor maintenance issues with the room (-1/2 star), but it was clean and the CitizenM room design was well thought out, however it would have been nice to have two luggage drawers under the bed. The ipad is somewhat cumbersome at times, but it include a lot of nice features, and even recommendations for the city which we enjoyed (especially the Lavomatic bar). I also wasnât a huge fan of the need to schedule cleaning, as I forgot one day and inadvertently missed out, and the ironing room on our floor did not have working lights (-1/2 star).

We didnât have breakfast, but the 16th floor bar was a wonderful refuge, and both bartenders were fantastic. I particularly enjoyed the Hennessy XO for only â¬10 and the giant Affligem beers. All staff members were polite, however it seems that most people actually need help with the self-check in process.

The location of the hotel is somewhat away from the main drag if youâre a tourist, but the convenient access to Gare Lyon and Gare Austerlitz across the river was definitely nice, as were the adjacent river bars like Barapapa. Overall would stay here again.

Spent a long weekend with 3 nights in the hotel. Room was large and clean with an amazingly comfortable bed. Staff were extremely friendly. I really liked the aerial view of Paris on the carpet. Good view of the Paris skyline from the lounge bar on the top floor. We didn't spend much time there since we were too busy watching the freely available films :-)

For the very reasonable price, the room is acceptable. Too tech oriented that it was inconvenient and annoying. Cute room but bed aligned to window makes 2nd person sleeping along it very difficult to get out. For the non-nimble, will not work. Overall very cute hotel with many nooks in the lobby and breakfast room. If gare de lyon is not your main interest, no reason to stay here other than price.

Very modern hotel. Very.
Controls on the rooms features (lights, blinds, TV, etc) are through an iPad.
Bars and restaurants are very sleek and serve decent food and breakfast. Top floor bar has great views. Bed is comfy.
A cool version of the traditional uberfunctional French hotel.

Easy check-in with QR code. Room cozy but reasonably well organized; nice shower. Staff quite amiable. Breakfast was good, perhaps not quite worth 15â¬. AC non functioning on arrival, staff apologetic but without alternatives (no fans or opening windows). Another minor malfunction was reported but it was several hours before maintenance appeared (and I was sleeping so did not get fixed). Beds were quite comfortable and we had a nice peek-a-boo view of the Eiffel tower!

Modern designed hotel. Even size is not big, but space is used efficiently. It's fairly comfortable considering average French hotels are small.  Breakfast is very good,  lots of selections,  and good quality. Location is good, not far to any tourism hot spots.

Lovely and friendly staff, rooms very clean, just a bit too small. Location is great and generally it was a good experience. Mercy, Jasmine and Emilia were so lovely. A good place to stay if you donât have a lot of luggage ð

It's a fresh and cosy hotel.
The rooms are of ferry cabin size but very clean and with a comfy bed. The high tech smart home system is well integrated. It's very small but of high standard.
The big plus with this hotel is the penthouse bar with excellent staff and great views

Lovely hotel, perfectly located if you are travelling from Gare de Lyon train station.  Rooms are perfect size for a short stay and staff is super friendly. Cool that we can control so much of the room from the tablet. 4 stars only because the room was not super clean with lots of dust and hairs from previous guests. I would still stay here again though.

First, let me say, this was one of the best, modern, and clean hotels Iâve visited. When I arrived, it was raining and unfortunately, I got soaked in the rain upon walking from the train station to the hotel. Even though itâs not a long walk, the train was coming down hard and I was soaked, and so was my suitcase. The attendant luckily saw this and allowed me to check in almost 4 hours before check-in time. So thankful for this! After a long flight from America, and being caught in the rain, the last thing I wanted to do was walk around Paris soaked.

The fridge is stocked with 2 bottles of water every day. The location is also good as it is near the metro, many restaurants, bakeries, and shops. There is also a nice lounge on the main floor, and an even better lounge on the top floor with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. All the rooms are also non-smoking which is a plus for a non smoker like me. I really really enjoyed that the room was controlled with an iPad. You can control the lights, TV, blinds, and play movies and music that connected to the TV! After a long day of sightseeing, it was a nice highlight to come to a room with American movies and to wind down. Another plus was the bed. It was so big and super comfortable!

The only downside was yes the room was clean, but had a faint smell. Nothing foul but defiantly had a stench that could have been flushed out with a window being opened but the windows are locked.

Also, the attendant reserved a taxi for me and said that it was a flat rate of â¬32 to Orly. When I got to the airport, the driver charged me â¬45!!!!!! The driver said there was a reservation fee of â¬7 plus something else he mumbled. He spoke English perfectly fine up until I asked him about the fare then he âdidnât know how to say it in English.â Really? I believe the reservation part but how do you account for the rest that was charged? The staff member at the hotel should have told me this. I asked him twice, on two different occasions and both times he told me â¬32 flat. It would have been nice for him to be honest with me. That way I could make a better informed decision about my other options.

All in all, it was a good stay and I would stay again. I would  just be aware. After all, you are probably a tourist and their bottom line is to get us to spend more money.

Really comfortable hotel! It has the feeling of a luxurious hostel with its living room style lounges. Even the bar at the top floor feels like a living room. The rooms are comfortable, not big but they have everything you might need!

Great hotel chain, but man the kitchen could use a bit of improvement! I told my husband that I like airplane food more... But enough of the negative, because there are tons of positives. The hotel is visually appealing and super comfy. The rooms are tiny but super modern. You don't feel squished, in fact you feel quite comfortable. The beds are great. I usually have a hard time sleeping away from home, but I slept more than 10 hours in the comfy bed!

Not the best location, you are removed from all the attractions. Fantastic service... The living room area is amazing and well decorated. The breakfast is great and worth the money. Bed is amazing and the smart room features are nifty. The shower toilet situation is awful. Unless you are intimate with whoever you are staying with, you will be visiting the public bathroom.

Modern hotels with great amenities. Like their breakfast (extra cost). This location also has a bar at top floor (not roof-top). The room is a bit smaller than we thought, but the location is very convenient.

Also using iPad to control is a great idea, but the user experience of the software is not so good.

Really nice hotel! Good location. Very high tech room! If you are in the mood you can even take a shower with adjustable disco lights! I stayed in a room at the tenth floor. I had a really nice view over the city! To sum up, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Fantastic modern hotel with well thought out details. Room was cozy but cute. Enjoyed free movie selection. Only feedback would be: add conditioner to the bathroom toiletries, the alarm system was annoying, late check out by an extra hour was quite difficult to arrange (front desk didn't call me back until it was the original checkout time).

Always a fan of CitizenMâs - everything you need in a city hotel: exceptionally comfortable beds, great social spaces in central locations and a good use of technology.

That said, the rooms here could do with a bit more love as theyâre starting to show a bit of wear and tear, and our bathroom door didnât completely shut - not ideal in a small space.

If you donât need to be near Gare du Lyon, Iâd definitely try one of the other locations in the city instead.

Summary: Centrally located hotel with great transport connections. Fantastic staff. Innovative rooms that are very comfortable. Breakfast is tasty but limited, other food and drink ordered can be pricey. Would love to stay here again!

Getting there: Pretty easy to locate, right next to Paris Gare de Lyon (who would have guessed?) which has many different RER and metro lines.

The hotel: Fantastic, friendly staff that even managed to move our room for a better view when requested at check in (View from room enclosed). Rooms are a good size, perfect for couples. Very large bed with rain shower! Everything in the room is controlled with an iPad, making room use very simple. Free movies are not yet included in rooms because of the hotel recently opening. Breakfast was included for our time every morning and was tasty but selection of food is limited. Other food and drink ordered outside breakfast can be pricey.

Small chic rooms with just what you need, and not much room for anything else! Super comfy bedding, and amazing sound proofing make for a great night's sleep. One little issue is the 'tech' is a bit buggy , with lights randomly turning on and the 'gentle' wake up being the exact opposite of!

Stayed here for 6 days and here are my findings.  Breakfast is great however a little overpriced. Would have liked to see coffee or tea in the room for customers to make however the only things you will find is water. Limited TV channels in English however the staff both at the downstairs and upstairs bars along with the staff that checked us in and out were very helpful. Very close to RER.

Great hotel, it is clean , and staff are very helpful and attentive. My only two comments are, a coffee pot in the room would be a nice addition and also location was a bit far from the centre, however it is very close to metro station overall I had a good experience

Lovely stay at CitizenM, although I would have appreciated a bigger room. The staff was really helpful and gave us great tips for our first stay in the city. There were not a lot of vegan options for breakfast but Yoli did understood our concerns and Lucie gave us some advice on vegan restaurants in the area that exceeded our expections. Also big shoutout to Isabel, her Disney expertise helped us have a magical day at the parks.

Overall a very nice experience and great staff!

P.S., Wanna know why they call Paris the City of Lights? Check their rooftop!

The Hotel itself was a new experience for me, new technologies applied for everything including self check-in check-out ,controlling lights ,and curtains through ipad, but I cannot make my evaluation based on this , as it is not the main issue for me.
here are positive points:
1. the location was very good at least for me since I planned to travel to Geneva from Gare de lyon , the hotel is very near to gare de lyon.
2. The lobby is amazing and has very nice decoration.
3. the rooms are clean and the bath is good as well.
4. Good wifi.
5. The view was amazing through the window.
6. The rooms were soundproof.
7. We forget some stuffs in the lobby and the staff bringed them to our room once they found it.
Negative points:
1. Small rooms.
2. I just didn't like the sink to be inside the rooms instead of the bath.
3. The bed was too high and directly touch the wall which was not nice.
4. Non-availability of tea/coffee facilities.

Great location, just in front of The station. Easy access in and out. Automatic check in system is cool. Well equipped boutique hotel. However i found bunch of dust on the bed, and basin stuck. And TV doesnât work well.

Nice efficient hotel in Paris

Bar:
Nice view from the top. Nice to rest and have a bit of Champagne while looking at the eiffel tower.

Rooms:
Small but, I guess that it's why it's efficient

Breakfasts:
Really good! Love France for their good breakfasts!

Kind of strange hotel but I think I like it:

There I classic reception more a guided self service terminal. Staff is English speaking and friendly.

I wouldnât recommend to go for the breakfast. Itâs way to little for the price of 17â¬.

The room size is ok as youâre not in for long and I liked all the âsmart homeâ connectivity.

BUT a real minus: light in the bathroom is only manageable via the iPad. The iPad has no option to turn off the screen. Means the whole night the screen in on or you put it up side down and the next morning the battery is empty. You can imagine no light in the bathroom ;)
We just asked for our way, and the lady was nice with us.

First things first : you canÂ´t go bad with citizenm hotels. Fun, well apointed rooms, cozy vibes, often some good rooftop bars and friendly people ð The reason i gave this one 4 stars is because the staff, altough they are friendly , come over as they are bored. I understand it is low season, but every time i went to the canteen or so they were sometimes more staff then people, gathering around and more talking to eachother and sitting on tables then focussing on the guests which is a shame and a bumper on the vibe in the room :) Keep the energetic vibes !
They were correct about everything! No lies! The location was fantastic and it was a brand new hotel with modern technology! Even though room was very tiny bit of had everything hung you needed!

Small rooms (to be expected in Paris), with super comfortable king size bed.... Utilizes technology to make it a great experience - iPad controls tv, lights, air conditioning, blinds, etc.... Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is a 3 minute walk to the Gare de Lyon station (which will take you pretty much anywhere you'd need to go).

The area is not to my usual taste but it is close to Gare de Lyon which is a big metro and itâs only 20min walk to Marais district.  The hotel itself is the usual tech and friendly standard of CitizenM. Very roomy bed in an otherwise compact but well designed room good for two people, preferably couples.  Best things was CloudM the rooftop bar overlooking Paris.

A well located hotel in Paris next to Gare de Lyon. The staff are very friendly and speak many languages. The room is a bit small but the space is very well used and it is all with smart technology. Recommended

Our third time staying at the Paris C.M hotel.  Within walking distance of Gare de Lyon, local buses directly outside also, plentiful cafe bars snd restaurants.   The area is within Paris 11/12th District.  A chilled boho vibe when walking through the streets.
C.M has a great bar restaurant in main entrance serving fresh breakfast, lunches, light, tasty teatime meals. A good choice for vegetarian eatersð.
TWO friendly suggestions: I forgot to bring mine and missed BODY LOTION.  And, a suggestion for the restaurant: A quality dual-gauged Juicing machine for on-the-spot juiced organic veggies and fruit?ð¤

We always use CitizenM when staying in London.
This one was still great, but the welcome wasnât as warm as we were used to, and we didnât realise that room cleaning had to be requested until it was too late - so we were low on towels and toilet roll.
Food & drink is expensive - and the bartender on floor 16 seemed offended that we only had the one drink.

Excellent in most every way.  What you might expect from a $300 per night in the late spring.  Across the street from Metro and RER but not close to anything else notable.  Very new and modern.  Black and red art them everywhere.  Breakfast NOT included.  Modern iPad controlled room which mostly worked (try the roomâs mood lighting in âParty Modeâ).  Ability to check out large umbrellas.  Free Evian water in the room which is nice.  Various international electric outlets (US included).  Nice view of the Seine from the 16th floor cocktail lounge.  Friendly service and everyone speaks English.

Staff , facilities, and functions were brilliant for the budget. also that view ! Sure those rooms are not the largest or the most spacious but the beds are comfortable, the rooms clean, and the location brilliant.

Conveniently located 5 mins from Gare de Lyon. Rooms are small but bed is King size and therefore occupies a big portion of the room. Only basic amenities avail, so don't expect slippers or night gowns.

Very modern feeling (smart room, self checking in) . The room are small but very clean. The bed is very comfortable.
The staff are very helpful and nice.
Good for business trips.

Hyper modern hotel where you can check in yourself on the computers at the 1st floor. Modern room sparkling clean and tablet controlled. Nice view at the bar on the 16th floor where you can see the eifeltower shining at night. Only con is the music everywhere. And at the end it's not expensive so you get good value for your money.

If you like domotics rooms, this is your place to stay. I like the hotel system with smart lighting control system for the mood you want to. The IPad controls everything and give you recommendations where to eat, dance, visit and shop. Good Movies to watch and catch up the station radio in French! Good music to start your day. Comfortable furnitures and the shower itâs so relaxing. Breakfast itâs ok and friendly service. The check in have to be with your QR code and the registration itâs do it by yourself. Also, if you donât want room service the profit that hotel safe itâs donated to an NGO for kids. For the other hand, the bar itâs only open until 00:00. So better if you go to a bar around the hotel.
Nice modern hotel. The best place for meeting with the people. It's lobby is really relaxing place. The rooms are small, really for sleeping only, but nice and simply equipped.

Hi Katerina, thanks for sharing your experience with us, great to hear you enjoyed the modern feel and cleanliness of our hotel. Our housekeeping team puts a lot of heart in what they do, so our guests can enjoy a clean and welcoming environment. Sorry to hear the area is not your favorite, but indeed, the metro is a stone away so you can always escape to you favorite parts of town. Also, just around the corner from the hotel you can enjoy a nice walk along the beautiful Seine, we find that to be a jewel! Hope to see you soon, citizenAlina

I think this hotel is great. The staff are helpful and friendly. The breakfast is good and the coffee is terrific- thatâs saying a lot given most coffee places in France are merd. I would stay here again.
Modern and clean, the bed is very comfortable and the room is a good size.  The location is convenient, with good public transport connections but it is not the most charming part of Paris.
Close to station which is good and bad. Nothing to do in the immediate area.
Good location and near to GARE De Lyon, but no supermarket nearby and not so many restaurants too.

Great location. Very close to Gare de Lyon station - hence the name. ð Typical CitizenM fare in rooms, bar and facilities. Although the rooms are getting a bit unpleasant with all the wear and tear.

Nice hotel, very friendly. I loved their green soup!
If you go to Paris this hotel is fine, not too far away, clean, modern, funny and cozy.

Clean room, huge bed. But, Hub software was broken in the morning. Checkin and checkout process cannot be done by myself on their machine. Overall, the software is terrible while the hardware is great.

Ever seen the movie 5th element? Well how about staying in a hotel that makes you feel like you could just be living in that universe.

This is a funky hotel with lots of atmosphere. Very close to the station and some awesome nightlife any day of the week.
Hotel is decent for a budget option with a decent location. But while we were there, air con was not working and laundry service was not running correctly.
Modern and cool hotel. Rooms were tiny as usual in Paris. Room was nice and clean with modern appliances.
Great hotel, great location. Having garee de Lyon 4mn away made navigating Paris easy. I'd have loved to have iron in my room.
A nice hotel with small but comfortable rooms, well placed close to the gare de Lyon. The prices are reasonable and we enjoyed our stay.
Walking distant to Gare de Lyon. Plenty of bistros and cafes around. There is also a supermarket nearby. Room is clean n comfortable. Staff are warm n pleasant.
Bed is very comfortable. The bar on the top floor is excellent. We found some staff extremely rude and the food is honestly, horrible.
It was a nice cozy hotel. Very nice details and kind staff. We enjoyed our stay there.
You feel as a citizen of the hotel! Unique experience with a great location! Use train or bike to go anywhere.
The room is quiet small, and it seems has almost self-service check in, although the staff will give help.
Service and hospitality are what take the cake here but the rooms themselves are exactly as advertised, great beds with very modern/functional amenities. Recommended.
Modern, good price and location by Gare de Lyon.  Room is tight but high tech and king bed.  Great view of river.
Really nice hotel, enjoyed the skybar however wouldâve been nicer with an actual open view.
All you want from a hotel without anything you don't need. Small rooms but plenty of communal space. Good value.
Nice hotel, a bit pricey and the rooms are small but it's full of art and had a great shower
Very modern high tech place.  Rooms are small but comfortable and quiet. Don't go if you can't use an Ipad
Great stay. Comfortable room. Not the best part of town unless you need an early train.
The hotel is nice.  But the cleaning of the room is not so good .
Good beds, nice shower, great location, all you need for a city break. Stayed in London also, will return.
Room is very high tech, but a bit small, the sink is too small
The hotel is economical and well connected. The rooms are small but have great view
Underutilized rooftop bar. Great view but small windows and Limited food assortiment

Great location. Good vibes and service
Great value!
Amazing interiors, huuuuge bed, the fastest WiFi Iâve ever encountered in a hotel. Loved it!!!

State of the art in everything, excelt in cleaning the room floor.
Loved the design very friendly staff.
Lovely room, down side was the sink didn't empty properly and when you opened the door to the toilet it made a really loud banging noise.
Everything is very good but the rooms are v small as well as the windows that can't be open
Food is not good .Hotel havent sports chanel staff is good also rooms is too small but for Paris its ok
Good hotel. Modern and clean. Very funky and adult. Good location
Small hotel conveniently located, small rooms, but very cozy with a modern touch
Great place to stay. Good service and everything you need in a hotel.
Nice Common rooms, excellent breakfast, small bedrooms but cosy
Bar upstairs certainly has a great vibe. Great view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance
Just opened. Very nice concept. Very central. Room small but clean and very comfortable
Nice rooms and location. Close to train station and restaurants.
Visit their cocktail bar on the 16th floor! Views are amazing - aim for a clear day though!
Great hotel, surrounding area not perfect although close to metro
Smaller than the one in London but still a great experience. Very friendly service.
Location isn't the best. But citizenM has clean rooms, and nice staff.
Itâs all good , nice kids at the service desk . Expensive popcorn .
kind and very good hotel. But little far from the terminal.
Near public transit & the train station, professional staff, nice breakfast but bit expensive...overall it was a good experience.
Nice bright and modern rooms, very handy for the station.
Excellent location , clean rooms ...
Good location for connection via train bit less than la defense citizenM still okay
CitizenM, always great. Just outside of the Gare de Lyon station.  In walking distance of the city center.
Looks like  a very trendy modern hotel ! Wanna to try it one day
Nice place to stay near 'Gare de Lyon' Railway Station.
Second stay at CitizenM this year and every bit as great as CitizenM Taipei.
Trendy small rooms. Fun hotel.
The place to be! Apple kingdom...for Apple community. Straf super (too ;-)) friendly
lovely hotel, great staff, great location
Very modern and fast forward hotel.
hotel high tech deco top personnel agreable!
Smart hotel. Easy checking checkout ourselves.
Friendly staff, comfortable bed
Very good place although really expensive.
Clean quick and good wifi
Quirky modern but slept like a log
Very beautiful place to stay.
Good location, friendly staff
Large bed, good location
The citizen high-tech Always ð
Stylish, modern, clean, friendly
A new experience. .just try

Sehr funktional eingerichtet, mit ein paar netten Extras. FÃ¼r einen relativ kurzen City Trip perfekt.
Zimmer viel zu kalt, Steuerung der Klimaanlage funktionierte nicht.

ik heb het bij alle vragen al toegelicht maar het komt er op neer dat a.: kamer was niet schoon bij aankomst en b.: meubilair vertoont al behhorlijke wear and tear. met name vlekken e.d. op het stoffen meubilair.

el hotel queda bien ubicado, cerca de la estaciÃ³n del metro y del RER, por mi parte a mi esposo se le perdieron dos camisas, esa es la Ãºnica observaciÃ³n, pues nunca nos habia ocurrido algo asi en un hotel. no es un hotel de lujo, pero cumple con lo necesario, les aconsejo que tomen el desayuno bufett, es muy completo, la atenciÃ³n normal, es un hotel en el que uno mismo debe hacer el check in y el out.

citizenM Paris Gare de Lyon provided excellent basic lodging for us (married couple) who did not intend to spend much time in the hotel room other than to sleep and shower. The room was clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The location, while in a more busy section of Paris, was convenient for taking the Metro either from Gare de Lyon or Gare d'Austerlitz. Surprisingly, the hotel was extremely quiet, considering the amount of traffic outside. It was the most quiet hotel that I have ever stayed in. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Our family of 2 boys stayed in 2 rooms. It worked really well - air con works, bed comfy, clean, tech works, showers good. Small rooms but the Communal spaces are good. In the worse heat of summer this place was a saviour for us! Would recommend to other families but you defo need 1 room per child / parent.

This is a fabulous spot to stay in the 12e arrondisement. Smartly designed rooms; excellent food and drink services; top notch wifi and workspaces; ultra-friendly, multilingual staff. The hotel's proximity to Gare d'Lyon opens many options for train and metro travel, too. Easy to navigate to/from CDG airport. For business travelers: you couldn't pick a better spot in Paris.

Modern, clean and comfortable tech forward hotel conveniently located next to Gare de Lyon and a short walk from Gare dâAusterlitz. |Close to most Paris attractions and neighborhoods. |Friendly accommodating staff. Very helpful if the techie stuff gets a bit confusing.|Hearty and tasty breakfast buffet. Common lounge areas and workspaces.

We had CD an exceptional stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to o friends when in Paris. Service was great, close to Metro and train lines for easy travel through the city and room size was very comfortable

Everything was great! The hotel is clean, the location is nice and most importantly it is safe, it is easy to reach places to visit. Also, all the staff are very friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend it.
Super convenient location, able to choose a quiet floor, felt very safe and comfortable, staff very helpful. Would stay here again and at other locations.

Perfect check in and out.Nice cozy place for relax and hang out with friends in their relax area.Wonderful breakfast. Hot and cold and free coffee and tea .Only complain is the bed has only one side climb in .Disadvantage for older people .Overall ,a super nice and friendly hotel.

A great location, quiet area and a short walking distance to the interchange of railways and metros. Centralised location which make it easy for traveller like me with an active itinerary to go around Paris. The view from hotel room was fantastic that I can view the nearby canal and Eiffel Tower can be seen too. The staff service was great. The room was spacious with comfortable double bed. I love the smart controller using mini ipad to control the lighting, blind, curtain and TV. There is a nice bakery shop at the corner for quick bites especially for breakfast. Overall, convenient location and safe. Will come back to stay here again for my next visit.
